original: chu srid drug cu dbyu gu gcig / dbyu gu drug cu nyin zhag gcig / drug cu drug cus bsgyur ba'i chu srang stong phrag sum brgya drug cu lus la yod do //
analyzed: chu srid drug cu dbyu gu gcig / dbyu gu drug cu nyin zhag gcig / drug cu drug cus bsgyur ba'i chu srang stong phrag sum brgya drug cu lus la yod do //
translated: Sixty breaths are one ghaṭikā. Sixty ghaṭikās are one day. There are 3,600 ghaṭikās in the body.

original: phyi rol du nyi ma ni lo gcig gis khyim bcu gnyis 'khor ro /
analyzed: phyi rol du nyi ma ni lo gcig gis khyim bcu gnyis 'khor ro /
translated: Externally, the sun moves through the twelve houses in one year.

original: lus la lte ba'i rtsa bcu gnyis la nyin zhag gcig gis so //
analyzed: lus la lte ba'i rtsa bcu gnyis la nyin zhag gcig gis so //
translated: In the body, it moves through the twelve channel petals at the navel in one day.

original: zla ba gcig la dbyu gu brgya phrag bco brgyad kyis 'pho ba gcig @254a * //
analyzed: zla ba gcig la dbyu gu brgya phrag bco brgyad kyis 'pho ba gcig @254a * //
translated: One month is one movement of the moon, which is eighteen hundred finger lengths.

original: go ; lus kyi sna bug gcig la dbugs brgya phrag bco brgyad kyis 'pho ba gcig go //
analyzed: go ; lus kyi sna bug gcig la dbugs brgya phrag bco brgyad kyis 'pho ba gcig go //
translated: One movement in the body is eighteen hundred breaths in one nostril.

original: zhag mang nyung ltar dbugs mang nyung gis so //
analyzed: zhag mang nyung ltar dbugs mang nyung gis so //
translated: The number of breaths is in accordance with the number of days.

original: phyi rol du nyi mas dkyil 'khor gcig la longs spyod ba ni zhag drug gi dbyu gu sum brgya drug cu'o //
analyzed: phyi rol du nyi mas dkyil 'khor gcig la longs spyod ba ni zhag drug gi dbyu gu sum brgya drug cu'o //
translated: Externally, the sun enjoys one maṇḍala in six days, which is three hundred and sixty finger lengths.

original: sna bug la dkyil 'khor gcig gi longs spyod ni dbugs sum brgya drug cu'o //
analyzed: sna bug la dkyil 'khor gcig gi longs spyod ni dbugs sum brgya drug cu'o //
translated: In the nostrils, one maṇḍala is enjoyed in three hundred and sixty breaths.

original: sna bug re re dkyil 'khor lnga rgyu ste dbyu gu lngas so //
analyzed: sna bug re re dkyil 'khor lnga rgyu ste dbyu gu lngas so //
translated: Each nostril has five maṇḍalas, which are moved by five finger lengths.

original: sna bug gnyi gar 'og tu sa'i dkyil 'khor dang / g-yon du chu'i dang / g-yas su me'i dang / steng du rlung gi dang / dbus su nam mkha'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: sna bug gnyi gar 'og tu sa'i dkyil 'khor dang / g-yon du chu'i dang / g-yas su me'i dang / steng du rlung gi dang / dbus su nam mkha'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: In both nostrils, below is the earth mandala, on the left is the water mandala, on the right is the fire mandala, above is the wind mandala, and in the middle is the space mandala.

original: mnyam par rgyu ba ni gnyig las so //
analyzed: mnyam par rgyu ba ni gnyig las so //
translated: Equal movement is from both.

original: dkyil 'khor re re la dbugs sum brgya drug cu ste /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor re re la dbugs sum brgya drug cu ste /
translated: In each mandala there are three hundred and sixty breaths.

original: de la tha mar bcu gcig bzhi cha dbu mar mnyam par rgyu'o //
analyzed: de la tha mar bcu gcig bzhi cha dbu mar mnyam par rgyu'o //
translated: At the end of that, one-fourth of the eleventh is the equal movement in the middle.

original: sna bug g-yon nas nam mkha' la sogs pa dang / g-yas nas la sogs pa ni rim pas rgyu ba'o //
analyzed: sna bug g-yon nas nam mkha' la sogs pa dang / g-yas nas la sogs pa ni rim pas rgyu ba'o //
translated: In the left nostril, space and so on move in sequence, and in the right nostril, fire and so on move in sequence.

original: g-yon nas nam mkha' lha ni sgra gcan no //
analyzed: g-yon nas nam mkha' lha ni sgra gcan no //
translated: In the left nostril, the deity of space is Rāhu.

original: g-yas su dus me'o //
analyzed: g-yas su dus me'o //
translated: In the right, it is Kālāgni.

original: de bzhin du rlung la zla ba dang nyi ma'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rlung la zla ba dang nyi ma'o //
translated: Similarly, in the wind, there is the moon and sun.

original: me la lag pa dang mig dmar ro //
analyzed: me la lag pa dang mig dmar ro //
translated: In the fire, there is the hand and Mars.

original: chu la pa ba sangs dang phur bu'o //
analyzed: chu la pa ba sangs dang phur bu'o //
translated: In the water, there is Venus and Mercury.

original: sa la mjug rings dang spen pa'o //
analyzed: sa la mjug rings dang spen pa'o //
translated: In the earth, there is Saturn and Ketu.

original: rkyang ma ni sa bon rgyu ba'o //
analyzed: rkyang ma ni sa bon rgyu ba'o //
translated: The lalanā is the movement of the seed.

original: ro ma ni khrag rgyu ba'o //
analyzed: ro ma ni khrag rgyu ba'o //
translated: The rasanā is the movement of blood.

original: lte ba'i nang du rtse 'dab pa bzhi dang // de'i phyir brgyad dang / de'i phyir bcu gnyis dang / de'i phyir drug cu rtsa bzhi'o //
analyzed: lte ba'i nang du rtse 'dab pa bzhi dang // de'i phyir brgyad dang / de'i phyir bcu gnyis dang / de'i phyir drug cu rtsa bzhi'o //
translated: then eight, then twelve, then sixty-four.🔽Above the navel, at a distance of one and a half inches, in the heart, there are eight channels.

original: lte ba'i steng du sor phyed dang bcu gsum na snying gar rtsa 'bab brgyad dang / 'dir 'pho ba ni thur re rer dbyu gu phyed dang brgyad kyis dbugs brgya phrag nyer bdun gyis so //
analyzed: lte ba'i steng du sor phyed dang bcu gsum na snying gar rtsa 'bab brgyad dang / 'dir 'pho ba ni thur re rer dbyu gu phyed dang brgyad kyis dbugs brgya phrag nyer bdun gyis so //
translated: Here, the movement is by twenty-seven hundred breaths, each of which is one and a half measures.

original: srog rlung ni sna bug g-yas nas gyen du rgyu'o //
analyzed: srog rlung ni sna bug g-yas nas gyen du rgyu'o //
translated: The life-force wind moves upward in the right nostril.

original: thur sel ni g-yon nas 'og tu rgyu'o //🔽shar du snang ma'i rtsa la mnyam gnas so //
analyzed: thur sel ni g-yon nas 'og tu rgyu'o // shar du snang ma'i rtsa la mnyam gnas so //
translated: The downward-voiding wind moves downward in the left nostril.🔽In the east, in the channel of the elephant, is the fire-accompanying wind.

original: mer glang chen gyi rtsa la gyen du rgyu'o //
analyzed: mer glang chen gyi rtsa la gyen du rgyu'o //
translated: In the southeast, in the channel of the bull, is the upward-moving wind.

original: lhor dmar ser gyi rtsa la khyab byed do //🔽bden bral du rgyal gyi rtsa la klu'o //🔽nub tu rgyal ba'i rtsa la dus sbal lo //
analyzed: lhor dmar ser gyi rtsa la khyab byed do // bden bral du rgyal gyi rtsa la klu'o // nub tu rgyal ba'i rtsa la dus sbal lo //
translated: In the south, in the channel of the red-brown horse, is the pervading wind.🔽In the southwest, in the channel of the scorpion, is the reactive wind.

original: rlung du sku'i rtsa la rtsangs pa'o //
analyzed: rlung du sku'i rtsa la rtsangs pa'o //
translated: In the west, in the channel of the snake, is the turtle wind.🔽In the northwest, in the channel of the monkey, is the lizard wind.

original: byang du lug gi rtsa la lha sbyin no //
analyzed: byang du lug gi rtsa la lha sbyin no //
translated: In the north, in the channel of the ram, is the god-given wind.

original: dbang ldan du ku ha'i rtsa la nor rgyal lo //
analyzed: dbang ldan du ku ha'i rtsa la nor rgyal lo //
translated: In the powerful one, the life-force is in the Kuha channel.

original: dbus ma la srog ste skye bo kun la sbyor /
analyzed: dbus ma la srog ste skye bo kun la sbyor /
translated: In the middle one, the life-force is in the life channel, which connects to all beings.

original: thur sel ni dung can ma la'o //
analyzed: thur sel ni dung can ma la'o //
translated: The downward-voiding one is in the conch shell.

original: g-yas g-yon gyi srog rlung gis stobs skyed do //
analyzed: g-yas g-yon gyi srog rlung gis stobs skyed do //
translated: The life-force winds on the right and left increase strength.

original: thur sel ni bza' btung 'og tu 'khyer ro //
analyzed: thur sel ni bza' btung 'og tu 'khyer ro //
translated: The downward-voiding one carries food and drink downward.

original: mnyam gnas ni ro mnyam par byed do //
analyzed: mnyam gnas ni ro mnyam par byed do //
translated: The fire-coinciding one makes tastes equal.

original: gyen rgyu lus g-yo bar byed pa dang / khas glu dang dgod pa la sogs pa @254b dang / lag pa dang rkang pas gar dang 'gro ba la sogs pa byed do //
analyzed: gyen rgyu lus g-yo bar byed pa dang / khas glu dang dgod pa la sogs pa @254b dang / lag pa dang rkang pas gar dang 'gro ba la sogs pa byed do //
translated: The upward-moving one moves the body, and through the mouth it causes singing, laughter, and so on, and through the arms and legs it causes dancing, walking, and so on.

original: khyab byed ni chu la sogs pa'i dbang gis lus la nad byed do //
analyzed: khyab byed ni chu la sogs pa'i dbang gis lus la nad byed do //
translated: The pervading one causes illness in the body through the power of water and so on.

original: klu yis sgregs par byed do //
analyzed: klu yis sgregs par byed do //
translated: The naga one causes belching.

original: rus sbal gyis rkang lag skum par byed do //
analyzed: rus sbal gyis rkang lag skum par byed do //
translated: The tortoise one causes the arms and legs to contract.

original: rtsangs pas 'khrug pa dang khro bar byed do //
analyzed: rtsangs pas 'khrug pa dang khro bar byed do //
translated: The lizard one causes agitation and anger.

original: lha sbyin gyis g-yal bar byed do /
analyzed: lha sbyin gyis g-yal bar byed do /
translated: The devadatta one causes yawning.

original: nor rgyal gyis ni shi ba'i lus kyang mi 'dor ba'o //
analyzed: nor rgyal gyis ni shi ba'i lus kyang mi 'dor ba'o //
translated: The riches one does not abandon even a dead body.

original: rtsa brgyad po'i 'di dag ni brgya byin la sogs pa phyogs pa bdag gi rang bzhin te thun rgyu ba'o //
analyzed: rtsa brgyad po'i 'di dag ni brgya byin la sogs pa phyogs pa bdag gi rang bzhin te thun rgyu ba'o //
translated: These eight are the lords of the directions, Indra, etc., and they move in the watches.

original: snying gi steng du sor phyed dang bcu gsum gyi mthar mgul pa la 'dab ma sum cu rtsa gnyis te /
analyzed: snying gi steng du sor phyed dang bcu gsum gyi mthar mgul pa la 'dab ma sum cu rtsa gnyis te /
translated: At the end of thirteen and a half finger-widths above the heart, in the throat, there are thirty-two petals.

original: bzhi mi rgyu ba'o //
analyzed: bzhi mi rgyu ba'o //
translated: They do not move in the watches.

original: gza' dang bcas pa'i skar ma'i 'khor lo ste /
analyzed: gza' dang bcas pa'i skar ma'i 'khor lo ste /
translated: This is the wheel of the stars with the planets.

original: dbyu gu drug cu las dbyug pa la sogs pa nyi shu rtsa brgyad kyis bgos pas thob pa de dbyu gu gnyis dang chu srang brgyad de 'dab ma re re la'o //
analyzed: dbyu gu drug cu las dbyug pa la sogs pa nyi shu rtsa brgyad kyis bgos pas thob pa de dbyu gu gnyis dang chu srang brgyad de 'dab ma re re la'o //
translated: From sixty dhanus, divided by the twenty-eight, beginning with dhanus, the result is two dhanus and eight palas, which are in each petal.

original: mgul pa nas sor phyed gang bcu gsum nas dpral pa ste /
analyzed: mgul pa nas sor phyed gang bcu gsum nas dpral pa ste /
translated: From the throat, at the end of thirteen and a half finger-widths, is the forehead.

original: dbus su aa dkar po ste aa la sogs pa bcu drug gis bskor ba'o //
analyzed: dbus su aa dkar po ste aa la sogs pa bcu drug gis bskor ba'o //
translated: In the middle is white A, surrounded by the sixteen vowels.

original: 'dab ma bcu drug las 'dab ma gnyis dor nas zla ba'i rkang pa bcu bzhis dbyu gu drug cu la bgos pas thob pa dbyu gu bzhi dang chu srang bcu bdun 'dab ma re re nas rgyu'o //
analyzed: 'dab ma bcu drug las 'dab ma gnyis dor nas zla ba'i rkang pa bcu bzhis dbyu gu drug cu la bgos pas thob pa dbyu gu bzhi dang chu srang bcu bdun 'dab ma re re nas rgyu'o //
translated: Having omitted two petals from the sixteen petals, the fourteen parts of the moon divide sixty dhanus, the result being four dhanus and seventeen palas, which move in each petal.

original: de nas tshes gcig la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nas tshes gcig la sogs pa'o //
translated: Then, the first day of the month, and so on.

original: de nas sor bzhi pa'i steng du spyi gtsug padma 'dab ma bzhi thun mtshams bzhi ste //
analyzed: de nas sor bzhi pa'i steng du spyi gtsug padma 'dab ma bzhi thun mtshams bzhi ste //
translated: Then, above the four finger-widths, the four periods of the day, the four petals of the crown of the head lotus,

original: stong pa dang shin tu stong pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: stong pa dang shin tu stong pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: which have the nature of emptiness, great emptiness, and so on.

original: gsang gnas su 'dab ma sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi phyi rol gyi bcu drug la dbyangs yig rnams so //
analyzed: gsang gnas su 'dab ma sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi phyi rol gyi bcu drug la dbyangs yig rnams so //
translated: In the secret place, on the thirty-two petals, the sixteen on the outside are the vowels.

original: de'i nang bcu ni phung po dang / khams kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i nang bcu ni phung po dang / khams kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: The ten inside are the nature of the aggregates and constituents.

original: de'i nang du drug ste stod pa'o //
analyzed: de'i nang du drug ste stod pa'o //
translated: The six inside that are the six upper ones.

original: 'khor la drug brgya lnga bcu rtsa drug go //
analyzed: 'khor la drug brgya lnga bcu rtsa drug go //
translated: The retinue is six hundred and fifty-six.

original: 'dir dbu ma ma bgrangs so //
analyzed: 'dir dbu ma ma bgrangs so //
translated: Here, the central one is not counted.

original: dbugs ni lte ba dang / snying ga dang / mgul pa dang / dpral ba dag /
analyzed: dbugs ni lte ba dang / snying ga dang / mgul pa dang / dpral ba dag /
translated: The breath is at the navel, the heart, the throat, and the forehead.

original: spyi gtsug dang / sna bug dang / dbyu gu dang / skar ma dang / tshes dang / thun mtshams dang / dkyil 'khor lngas 'bigs nas dmigs med pa bcu gnyis kyi mtha' dang bcu drug / gnyis kyi mtha' dang drug gi mthar rgyu'o //
analyzed: spyi gtsug dang / sna bug dang / dbyu gu dang / skar ma dang / tshes dang / thun mtshams dang / dkyil 'khor lngas 'bigs nas dmigs med pa bcu gnyis kyi mtha' dang bcu drug / gnyis kyi mtha' dang drug gi mthar rgyu'o //
translated: The life force moves through the crown, the nostrils, the channels, the stars, the lunar mansions, the periods of the day, and the five mandalas, and it moves through the end of the twelve signlessnesses, the end of the sixteen, the end of the two, and the end of the six.

original: de nas ldog go //
analyzed: de nas ldog go //
translated: Then it reverses.

original: gnag gi tshe phyi rol du thung pa sor bcu gnyis su rgyu ba de'i tshe lte ba'i 'og tu sor bzhi rgyu'o //
analyzed: gnag gi tshe phyi rol du thung pa sor bcu gnyis su rgyu ba de'i tshe lte ba'i 'og tu sor bzhi rgyu'o //
translated: When it moves externally for twelve finger lengths, at that time it moves four finger lengths below the navel.

original: rkang pa g-yon pa'i tshigs gsum la 'khor lo gsum ste /
analyzed: rkang pa g-yon pa'i tshigs gsum la 'khor lo gsum ste /
translated: In the three joints of the left leg there are three cakras.

original: zla ba'i tshes kyi grangs kyis lha sum cu sta sa'i khams la snying stobs la sogs pa'i @255a * //🔽dbye bas so //
analyzed: zla ba'i tshes kyi grangs kyis lha sum cu sta sa'i khams la snying stobs la sogs pa'i @255a * // dbye bas so //
translated: The thirty gods are the lunar mansions, and the earth element is differentiated as sattva and so on.

original: rkang pa g-yas pa chu khams dang / lag pa g-yon pa me'i khams dang / lag pa g-yas pa rlung gi khams te lo gcig la bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: rkang pa g-yas pa chu khams dang / lag pa g-yon pa me'i khams dang / lag pa g-yas pa rlung gi khams te lo gcig la bcu gnyis so //
translated: The right leg is the water element, the left hand is the fire element, and the right hand is the wind element.

original: g-yon dang g-yas pa'i lag pa dang rkang pa'i sor mo rnams ni sa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: g-yon dang g-yas pa'i lag pa dang rkang pa'i sor mo rnams ni sa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The fingers and toes of the right and left hands and feet are earth and so forth.

original: sor mo'i tshigs gsum ni snying stobs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sor mo'i tshigs gsum ni snying stobs la sogs pa'o //
translated: The three joints of the fingers are sattva and so forth.

original: mthe bong sa'o //
analyzed: mthe bong sa'o //
translated: The thumb is earth.

original: sdigs mdzub chu'o //
analyzed: sdigs mdzub chu'o //
translated: The index finger is water.

original: gud mo me'o //
analyzed: gud mo me'o //
translated: The middle finger is fire.

original: ming med rlung ngo //
analyzed: ming med rlung ngo //
translated: The ring finger is wind.

original: mthe'u chung ni nam mkha'o //
analyzed: mthe'u chung ni nam mkha'o //
translated: The little finger is space.

original: skra dang ba spu bye ba phyed dang bzhi ni nam mkha'o //
analyzed: skra dang ba spu bye ba phyed dang bzhi ni nam mkha'o //
translated: The half-and-a-half hairs and pores are space.

original: ma'i khrag gis gsum ste /
analyzed: ma'i khrag gis gsum ste /
translated: The mother's blood is the three:

original: pags pa dang / sha dang khrag go //
analyzed: pags pa dang / sha dang khrag go //
translated: skin, flesh, and blood.

original: sku la sogs pa'i rigs ni gsum ste lte bar 'khor lo'i rigs dang / mgul par rin chen dang / gsang bar gri gug go //
analyzed: sku la sogs pa'i rigs ni gsum ste lte bar 'khor lo'i rigs dang / mgul par rin chen dang / gsang bar gri gug go //
translated: The three families of the body and so forth are the wheel family at the navel, the jewel family at the throat, and the curved knife family at the perineum.

original: pha'i sa bon gyis gsum steng rus pa dang / rkang mar dang / rgyus pa'o //
analyzed: pha'i sa bon gyis gsum steng rus pa dang / rkang mar dang / rgyus pa'o //
translated: The father's seed is the three: bones, marrow, and ligaments.

original: rigs kyang gsum ste /
analyzed: rigs kyang gsum ste /
translated: The families are also three:

original: dpral bar padma dang / snying gar ral gri dang / spyi gtsug tu rdo rje'o //
analyzed: dpral bar padma dang / snying gar ral gri dang / spyi gtsug tu rdo rje'o //
translated: the lotus family at the forehead, the sword family at the heart, and the vajra family at the crown.

original: mngal du zla ba gcig gi bar du 'byung ba lngar gyur pa'i las sa bon 'phel lo //
analyzed: mngal du zla ba gcig gi bar du 'byung ba lngar gyur pa'i las sa bon 'phel lo //
translated: For one month in the womb, the seed of the five elements increases.

original: zla ba gcig gi rjes su de'i myu gu snying gar srog la sogs pa'i gnas phra mo bcu'o //
analyzed: zla ba gcig gi rjes su de'i myu gu snying gar srog la sogs pa'i gnas phra mo bcu'o //
translated: After one month, its sprout is the ten subtle sites of life and so on at the heart.

original: lte bar drug cu bzhi dang de'i nang du 'pho ba'i rtsa ni bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: lte bar drug cu bzhi dang de'i nang du 'pho ba'i rtsa ni bcu gnyis so //
translated: At the navel there are sixty-four and within them the twelve channels of movement.

original: drug cu rtsa bzhi 'di dag lag pa dang rkang pa dang kha'i gnas dang byed pa'i steng du song ste /
analyzed: drug cu rtsa bzhi 'di dag lag pa dang rkang pa dang kha'i gnas dang byed pa'i steng du song ste /
translated: These sixty-four go to the sites of the hands, feet, and mouth and the upper body.

original: zla ba gnyis tshang nas lag pa la sogs pa cung zad 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zla ba gnyis tshang nas lag pa la sogs pa cung zad 'byung ngo //
translated: When two months are complete, the hands and so on slightly emerge.

original: rus sbal gyi gnas skabs su 'bur lnga ste lag pa gnyis dang rkang pa gnyis dang mgul bar mgo bo rkang lag gi tshigs drug la rtsa phra mo rnams so //
analyzed: rus sbal gyi gnas skabs su 'bur lnga ste lag pa gnyis dang rkang pa gnyis dang mgul bar mgo bo rkang lag gi tshigs drug la rtsa phra mo rnams so //
translated: In the tortoise stage, there are five protuberances: two hands, two feet, and the head at the throat. In the six joints of the hands and feet, there are subtle channels.

original: zla ba bzhi tshad nas mgrin par longs spyod kyi rtsa rnams so //
analyzed: zla ba bzhi tshad nas mgrin par longs spyod kyi rtsa rnams so //
translated: When four months are complete, there are the channels of enjoyment at the throat.

original: zla ba lnga la phag gi skabs su sha la brten nas rus pa sum brgya drug cu dang / de'i tshigs kyang sum brgya drug cu'o //
analyzed: zla ba lnga la phag gi skabs su sha la brten nas rus pa sum brgya drug cu dang / de'i tshigs kyang sum brgya drug cu'o //
translated: In the fifth month, in the pig period, the bones are formed from the flesh, and there are also three hundred and sixty joints.🔽In the sixth month, the faculties of the eyes, etc., are formed from the blood and the feeling of pleasure, etc.🔽In the seventh month, the faculties of the nose, tongue, and body are formed from the lymph.
