analyzed: de nas mi 'dod pa zhag gsum dang rang bzhin yang zhag gsum /
translated: Then, for three days it is not desired, and the natural [breath] also moves for three days.

original: yang mi 'dod pa zhag lnga na rang bzhin zhag lnga ste nam mkha'i dkyil 'khor zad do //
analyzed: yang mi 'dod pa zhag lnga na rang bzhin zhag lnga ste nam mkha'i dkyil 'khor zad do //
translated: Again, for five days it is not desired, and the natural [breath] moves for five days, and the sphere of space is exhausted.

original: yang mi 'dod pa zhag bdun rang bzhin zhag bdun no //
analyzed: yang mi 'dod pa zhag bdun rang bzhin zhag bdun no //
translated: Then, for seven days it is not desired, and the natural [breath] moves for seven days.

original: mi 'dod pa dgu rang bzhin zhag dgu'o //
analyzed: mi 'dod pa dgu rang bzhin zhag dgu'o //
translated: For nine days it is not desired, and the natural [breath] moves for nine days.

original: yang mi 'dod pa bcu gcig rang bzhin bcu gcig ste rlung gi dkyil 'khor zad do //
analyzed: yang mi 'dod pa bcu gcig rang bzhin bcu gcig ste rlung gi dkyil 'khor zad do //
translated: Again, for eleven days it is not desired, and the natural [breath] moves for eleven days, and the sphere of wind is exhausted.

original: de nas mi 'dod pa bcu gsum rang bzhin bcu gsum mo //
analyzed: de nas mi 'dod pa bcu gsum rang bzhin bcu gsum mo //
translated: Then, for thirteen days it is not desired, and the natural [breath] moves for thirteen days.

original: de nas mi 'dod pa bco lnga rang bzhin bco lnga'o //
analyzed: de nas mi 'dod pa bco lnga rang bzhin bco lnga'o //
translated: Then, for fifteen days it is not desired, and the natural [breath] moves for fifteen days.

original: de nas mi 'dod pa bcu bdun rang @258b bzhin bcu bdun te me'i dkyil 'khor zad do //
analyzed: de nas mi 'dod pa bcu bdun rang @258b bzhin bcu bdun te me'i dkyil 'khor zad do //
translated: Then, for seventeen days it is not desired, and the natural [breath] moves for seventeen days, and the sphere of fire is exhausted.

original: de nas mi 'dod pa bcu dgu rang bzhin bcu dgu'o //
analyzed: de nas mi 'dod pa bcu dgu rang bzhin bcu dgu'o //
translated: Then there are nineteen undesirable [days] and nineteen natures.

original: de nas mi 'dod pa nyer gcig rang bzhin nyer gcig go //
analyzed: de nas mi 'dod pa nyer gcig rang bzhin nyer gcig go //
translated: Then there are twenty-one undesirable [days] and twenty-one natures.

original: de nas mi 'dod pa nyer gsum rang bzhin nyer gsum ste chu'i dkyil 'khor zad do //
analyzed: de nas mi 'dod pa nyer gsum rang bzhin nyer gsum ste chu'i dkyil 'khor zad do //
translated: Then there are twenty-three undesirable [days] and twenty-three natures, and the water maṇḍala is exhausted.

original: de nas mi 'dod pa nyer lnga rang bzhin nyer lnga'o //
analyzed: de nas mi 'dod pa nyer lnga rang bzhin nyer lnga'o //
translated: Then there are twenty-five undesirable [days] and twenty-five natures.

original: de nas mi 'dod pa nyer bdun rang bzhin nyer bdun no //
analyzed: de nas mi 'dod pa nyer bdun rang bzhin nyer bdun no //
translated: Then there are twenty-seven undesirable [days] and twenty-seven natures.

original: de nas mi 'dod pa nyer dgu rang bzhin nyer dgu ste sa'i dkyil 'khor zad do //
analyzed: de nas mi 'dod pa nyer dgu rang bzhin nyer dgu ste sa'i dkyil 'khor zad do //
translated: Then there are twenty-nine undesirable [days] and twenty-nine natures, and the earth maṇḍala is exhausted.

original: sum cu rtsa gsum de ni snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa'i dbye bas so //
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gsum de ni snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa'i dbye bas so //
translated: That is the thirty-third [day], divided into sattva, rajas, and tamas.

original: de nas sna bug g-yas pa la mi 'dod pa zhag gnyis dang rang bzhin zhag gnyis so //
analyzed: de nas sna bug g-yas pa la mi 'dod pa zhag gnyis dang rang bzhin zhag gnyis so //
translated: Then, in the right nostril, there are two undesirable [days] and two natures.

original: mi 'dod pa zhag bzhi dang rang bzhin zhag bzhi'o //
analyzed: mi 'dod pa zhag bzhi dang rang bzhin zhag bzhi'o //
translated: There are four undesirable [days] and four natures.

original: mi 'dod pa zhag drug dang rang bzhin zhag drug ste sa'i dkyil 'khor zad do //
analyzed: mi 'dod pa zhag drug dang rang bzhin zhag drug ste sa'i dkyil 'khor zad do //
translated: There are six undesirable [days] and six natures, and the earth maṇḍala is exhausted.

original: mi 'dod pa zhag brgyad dang rang bzhin zhag brgyad /
analyzed: mi 'dod pa zhag brgyad dang rang bzhin zhag brgyad /
translated: eight days of non-desire and eight of nature;

original: mi 'dod pa zhag bcu rang bzhin zhag bcu /
analyzed: mi 'dod pa zhag bcu rang bzhin zhag bcu /
translated: ten days of non-desire and ten of nature;🔽twelve days of non-desire and twelve of nature.

original: mi 'dod pa zhag bcu gnyis rang bzhin zhag bcu gnyis te chu'i dkyil 'khor zad do //
analyzed: mi 'dod pa zhag bcu gnyis rang bzhin zhag bcu gnyis te chu'i dkyil 'khor zad do //
translated: The water maṇḍala is exhausted.

original: mi 'dod pa zhag bcu bzhi rang bzhin bcu bzhi /
analyzed: mi 'dod pa zhag bcu bzhi rang bzhin bcu bzhi /
translated: Fourteen days of non-desire and fourteen of nature;🔽sixteen days of non-desire and sixteen of nature;

original: mi 'dod pa bcu drug rang bzhin bcu drug / mi 'dod pa bco brgyad rang bzhin bco brgyad de me'i dkyil 'khor zad do //
analyzed: mi 'dod pa bcu drug rang bzhin bcu drug / mi 'dod pa bco brgyad rang bzhin bco brgyad de me'i dkyil 'khor zad do //
translated: eighteen days of non-desire and eighteen of nature. The fire maṇḍala is exhausted.

original: mi 'dod pa nyi shu rang bzhin nyi shu /
analyzed: mi 'dod pa nyi shu rang bzhin nyi shu /
translated: Twenty days of non-desire and twenty of nature;

original: mi 'dod pa nyer gnyis rang bzhin nyer gnyis so //
analyzed: mi 'dod pa nyer gnyis rang bzhin nyer gnyis so //
translated: twenty-two days of non-desire and twenty-two of nature;

original: mi 'dod pa nyer bzhi rang bzhin nyer bzhi ste rlung gi dkyil 'khor zad do //
analyzed: mi 'dod pa nyer bzhi rang bzhin nyer bzhi ste rlung gi dkyil 'khor zad do //
translated: twenty-four days of non-desire and twenty-four of nature. The wind maṇḍala is exhausted.🔽Twenty-six days of non-desire and twenty-six of nature;

original: mi 'dod pa nyer drug rang bzhin nyer drug / mi 'dod pa nyer brgyad rang bzhin nyer brgyad /
analyzed: mi 'dod pa nyer drug rang bzhin nyer drug / mi 'dod pa nyer brgyad rang bzhin nyer brgyad /
translated: twenty-eight days of non-desire and twenty-eight of nature;

original: mi 'dod pa sum cu rang bzhin sum cu ste nam mkha'i dkyil 'khor zad do //
analyzed: mi 'dod pa sum cu rang bzhin sum cu ste nam mkha'i dkyil 'khor zad do //
translated: thirty days of non-desire and thirty of nature. The space maṇḍala is exhausted.

original: de nas g-yon du ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor la mi 'dod pa'i zhag sum cu rang bzhin sum cu ste de nas snying stobs kyi khams zad do //🔽de nas g-yas pa'i rnam shes kyi dkyil 'khor la mi 'dod pa so gnyis rang bzhin so gnyis te rdul gyi khams zad do //
analyzed: de nas g-yon du ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor la mi 'dod pa'i zhag sum cu rang bzhin sum cu ste de nas snying stobs kyi khams zad do // de nas g-yas pa'i rnam shes kyi dkyil 'khor la mi 'dod pa so gnyis rang bzhin so gnyis te rdul gyi khams zad do //
translated: Then, in the left nostril, the thirty-two days of the undesirable in the maṇḍala of gnosis are the thirty-two natures. After that, the element of sattva is exhausted.🔽Then, in the right nostril, the thirty-three days of the undesirable in the maṇḍala of consciousness are the thirty-three natures. After that, the element of rajas is exhausted.

original: de nas g-yon du ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor la mi 'dod pa so gsum rang bzhin so gsum ste mun pa'i khams zad do //🔽bad kan gyi rtsa zad pa ni snying stobs kyi khams so //
analyzed: de nas g-yon du ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor la mi 'dod pa so gsum rang bzhin so gsum ste mun pa'i khams zad do // bad kan gyi rtsa zad pa ni snying stobs kyi khams so //
translated: Then, in the left nostril, the thirty-four days of the undesirable in the maṇḍala of gnosis are the thirty-four natures. After that, the element of tamas is exhausted.🔽The exhaustion of the channel of phlegm is the element of sattva.

original: mkhris pa'i rtsa zad pa ni rdul gyi khams so //
analyzed: mkhris pa'i rtsa zad pa ni rdul gyi khams so //
translated: The exhaustion of the channel of bile is the element of rajas.

original: rlung gi rtsa zad pa ni mun pa'i khams so //
analyzed: rlung gi rtsa zad pa ni mun pa'i khams so //
translated: The exhaustion of the channel of wind is the element of tamas.

original: de ltar zhag ni brgya phrag bcu gcig dang nyer gnyis so //
analyzed: de ltar zhag ni brgya phrag bcu gcig dang nyer gnyis so //
translated: Thus, there are eleven hundred and twenty-two days.

original: mngal gyi tha ma'i zla ba gcig @259a * //
analyzed: mngal gyi tha ma'i zla ba gcig @259a * //
translated: The final month in the womb

original: zad par bya ba'i phyir sna bug g-yas pa la zhag gnyis rgyu'o //
analyzed: zad par bya ba'i phyir sna bug g-yas pa la zhag gnyis rgyu'o //
translated: is exhausted in two days in the right nostril.

original: dbugs kyi 'khor lo zad par bya ba'i phyir zhag gcig dbu ma nas rgyu'o //
analyzed: dbugs kyi 'khor lo zad par bya ba'i phyir zhag gcig dbu ma nas rgyu'o //
translated: For the purpose of exhausting the wheel of breath, [the wind] moves through the central channel for one day.

original: de dag ni zhag brgya phrag bcu gcig dang nyer lnga'o //
analyzed: de dag ni zhag brgya phrag bcu gcig dang nyer lnga'o //
translated: Those are eleven and twenty-five hundred days, respectively.

original: rtsa g-yon pa'am g-yas pa chad pas mi rgyu na tshe zla ba drug ste gci ba skyur mor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtsa g-yon pa'am g-yas pa chad pas mi rgyu na tshe zla ba drug ste gci ba skyur mor 'gyur ro //
translated: If the left or right channel is severed and [the wind] does not move, life ends in six months, and urine becomes sour.

original: tshe zhag drug pas sgra mi thos so //
analyzed: tshe zhag drug pas sgra mi thos so //
translated: In the sixth day of life, one cannot hear sounds.

original: tshe zhag lnga pas ro mi tshor ro //
analyzed: tshe zhag lnga pas ro mi tshor ro //
translated: In the fifth day of life, one cannot taste flavors.

original: tshe zhag bzhi pas gzugs mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: tshe zhag bzhi pas gzugs mi mthong ngo //
translated: In the fourth day of life, one cannot see forms.

original: tshe zhag gsum pas dri mi tshor ro //
analyzed: tshe zhag gsum pas dri mi tshor ro //
translated: In the third day of life, one cannot smell odors.

original: tshe zhag gnyis pas reg bya mi 'dzin no //
analyzed: tshe zhag gnyis pas reg bya mi 'dzin no //
translated: In the second day of life, one cannot feel tactile objects.

original: 'chi ba'i dus su sa bon dang dbugs stong ngo /
analyzed: 'chi ba'i dus su sa bon dang dbugs stong ngo /
translated: At the time of death, the seed and breath are exhausted.

original: // zhag drug pa'i sna'i rtse mo glang po'i sna ltar 'og tu zhum mo //
analyzed: // zhag drug pa'i sna'i rtse mo glang po'i sna ltar 'og tu zhum mo //
translated: In the sixth day, the tip of the nose sinks down like an elephant's trunk.

original: lag pa mgor bzhag na lag pa mi 'phra'o //
analyzed: lag pa mgor bzhag na lag pa mi 'phra'o //
translated: If one places one's hand on one's head, the hand does not move.

original: lag mthil gyis tshos mnyes kyang dmar por mi 'gyur ro //🔽nyi ma nag por mthong ngo //
analyzed: lag mthil gyis tshos mnyes kyang dmar por mi 'gyur ro // nyi ma nag por mthong ngo //
translated: Even if one presses with the palm of one's hand, it does not turn red.🔽One sees the sun as black.

original: zla ba gang ba ser por mthong ngo //
analyzed: zla ba gang ba ser por mthong ngo //
translated: One sees the full moon as yellow.

original: lce'i 'og tu ri mo nag po 'byung ngo //
analyzed: lce'i 'og tu ri mo nag po 'byung ngo //
translated: A black line appears under the tongue.

original: mig la nag po dmar po'i dkyil 'khor ri mo phra mo sub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mig la nag po dmar po'i dkyil 'khor ri mo phra mo sub par 'gyur ro //
translated: The red-black circle in the eye becomes a thin line.

original: dbugs sna bug gnyis kar rgyu'o //
analyzed: dbugs sna bug gnyis kar rgyu'o //
translated: Breath moves through both nostrils.

original: 'gram pa gnyis 'phrig go //
analyzed: 'gram pa gnyis 'phrig go //
translated: Both cheeks throb.

original: nu ma'i rtsa gnyis mchan khung gi nang du 'jug go //
analyzed: nu ma'i rtsa gnyis mchan khung gi nang du 'jug go //
translated: The two veins of the breasts enter the armpits.

original: skar ma rnams me stag 'phro bar mthong ngo //
analyzed: skar ma rnams me stag 'phro bar mthong ngo //
translated: The stars are seen as sparks.

original: lus dang mgul pa rengs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus dang mgul pa rengs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The body and neck become stiff.

original: lus 'khor ba zhes 'chi ltas shes nas sbyin ba la sogs pa bya'o //
analyzed: lus 'khor ba zhes 'chi ltas shes nas sbyin ba la sogs pa bya'o //
translated: Knowing the signs of death, one should practice generosity and so on.

original: 'jig rten du byed pa gang yin pa de nyid zad par byed pa yin te de ltar kun gzhi dang nyon mongs pa can gyi yid mngal du khrag dang sa bon la 'jug pa dang skyes pa dang byis pa dang gzhon nu la sogs pa skye bar byed
analyzed: 'jig rten du byed pa gang yin pa de nyid zad par byed pa yin te de ltar kun gzhi dang nyon mongs pa can gyi yid mngal du khrag dang sa bon la 'jug pa dang skyes pa dang byis pa dang gzhon nu la sogs pa skye bar byed
translated: Whatever creates the world also destroys it. Thus the all-base and afflicted mind enter the womb as blood and semen, and create birth as a fetus, child, youth, and so on.

original: do // 'chi ba'i dus su de nyid 'od gsal du thams cad 'jug par byed do //
analyzed: do // 'chi ba'i dus su de nyid 'od gsal du thams cad 'jug par byed do //
translated: At the time of death, they cause everything to enter clear light.

original: gang gi phyir sa bon la sogs pa'i rten la gnas pa'i rnam shes kyis thams cad sdud par byed do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sa bon la sogs pa'i rten la gnas pa'i rnam shes kyis thams cad sdud par byed do //
translated: Because consciousness, which is based on the seed and so on, gathers everything.

original: gang sdud ce na /
analyzed: gang sdud ce na /
translated: What does it gather?

original: zla ba sa bon dbang phyug dang / khrag nyi ma ste rtag tu dge ba dang / rkang mar drag po dang / gci ba khyab 'jug dang / bshang ba tshangs pa dang sa la sogs pa'i 'byung ba rnams te mngal na gnas pa rnam shes kyis 'di dag sdud par byed do //
analyzed: zla ba sa bon dbang phyug dang / khrag nyi ma ste rtag tu dge ba dang / rkang mar drag po dang / gci ba khyab 'jug dang / bshang ba tshangs pa dang sa la sogs pa'i 'byung ba rnams te mngal na gnas pa rnam shes kyis 'di dag sdud par byed do //
translated: The moon is the seed, the sun is blood, always virtuous, marrow is the strong one, urine is Vishnu, feces is Brahma, and the elements such as earth. Consciousness in the womb gathers these.

original: lte ba'i rtsa'i sgo nas lus ngag yid gsum skyes pa'i phyir de dag thams cad lus la 'dus te yan lag kun skyed do //
analyzed: lte ba'i rtsa'i sgo nas lus ngag yid gsum skyes pa'i phyir de dag thams cad lus la 'dus te yan lag kun skyed do //
translated: Because the body, speech, and mind are born from the door of the navel channel, all of them are gathered in the body and generate all the limbs.

original: dbugs kyis lte ba nas 'thon par byed do //
analyzed: dbugs kyis lte ba nas 'thon par byed do //
translated: Breath emerges from the navel.

original: slar yang spyi gtsug la sogs pa @259b drug la sdud par byed do //
analyzed: slar yang spyi gtsug la sogs pa @259b drug la sdud par byed do //
translated: Again, it gathers in the crown and so on.

original: rnal 'byor gyi sems ni bshang ba dang gci ba la sogs pa'i khams lus la gnas nas 'ju ba dang gsod pa la sogs pa sdud par byed do //
analyzed: rnal 'byor gyi sems ni bshang ba dang gci ba la sogs pa'i khams lus la gnas nas 'ju ba dang gsod pa la sogs pa sdud par byed do //
translated: The mind of yoga, abiding in the body, gathers the dhatus such as feces and urine, digesting and killing them.

original: slar yang rgyu lugs sna tshogs kyis gzugs nyid skyed do //
analyzed: slar yang rgyu lugs sna tshogs kyis gzugs nyid skyed do //
translated: Again, it generates form itself through various processes.

original: yang na 'chi ba'i dus su bsdus nas nyon mongs ba dang las rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i dbang gis skye ba phyi ma sna tshogs skyed do //
analyzed: yang na 'chi ba'i dus su bsdus nas nyon mongs ba dang las rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i dbang gis skye ba phyi ma sna tshogs skyed do //
translated: Or else, it generates the various future births through the power of various afflictions and actions, after gathering them at the time of death.

original: lus rdzogs pa na yul drug ni gzung bya dang dbang po drug dang lo dang zla ba dang phyogs nyin mo la sogs pa'i byed pa'o //
analyzed: lus rdzogs pa na yul drug ni gzung bya dang dbang po drug dang lo dang zla ba dang phyogs nyin mo la sogs pa'i byed pa'o //
translated: When the body is complete, the six objects are the things to be grasped, the six sense faculties are the agents, and the years, months, directions, days, and so on are the instruments.

original: 'on 'di ni kun rdzob pa yin pa'i phyir byed pa po la sogs par mi 'grub ste byed pa po la sogs pa 'di dag gzhan sdud pa yod de de yang lhan cig skyes pa'i sku don dam pa'o zhes ni gzhan zer ro //
analyzed: 'on 'di ni kun rdzob pa yin pa'i phyir byed pa po la sogs par mi 'grub ste byed pa po la sogs pa 'di dag gzhan sdud pa yod de de yang lhan cig skyes pa'i sku don dam pa'o zhes ni gzhan zer ro //
translated: But others say that since this is conventional, it is not established as an agent and so on, and that these agents and so on are included in others, and that is the ultimate body of attributes that is connate.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: gang gi tshe sdug bsngal gyi phung po nga rgyal tsam bdag ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe sdug bsngal gyi phung po nga rgyal tsam bdag ma yin te /
translated: When the mere pride of the mass of suffering is not the self,

original: des ni mi rtag pa sdug bsngal ba /
analyzed: des ni mi rtag pa sdug bsngal ba /
translated: it is impermanent, suffering,

original: stong pa / bdag med pa'i phung po la sogs pa la yid du 'ong ba la sogs par sgro btags nas 'dod chags la sogs pa'i 'ching bas dar gyi srin bu ltar 'ching bar byed do //
analyzed: stong pa / bdag med pa'i phung po la sogs pa la yid du 'ong ba la sogs par sgro btags nas 'dod chags la sogs pa'i 'ching bas dar gyi srin bu ltar 'ching bar byed do //
translated: Having superimposed pleasantness, etc. on the aggregates, etc. which are empty and selfless, one is bound by the bonds of passion, etc. like a silkworm in its cocoon.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes bskyed nas rtog pa'i dra ba 'joms te grol bar byed do //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes bskyed nas rtog pa'i dra ba 'joms te grol bar byed do //
translated: But having generated nonconceptual intuition, one destroys the net of conceptualization and becomes liberated.

original: de bas na byed pa po la sogs pa gang yang med do //
analyzed: de bas na byed pa po la sogs pa gang yang med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no agent, etc.

original: 'khor ba'i sems kyi rang bzhin ni brgyad da /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i sems kyi rang bzhin ni brgyad da /
translated: The nature of the mind in cyclic existence is eightfold.

original: sa la sogs pa lnga dang yid dang blo dang nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa lnga dang yid dang blo dang nga rgyal lo //
translated: It consists of the five, earth, etc., mind, reason, and the I-maker.

original: de yang gsum ste /
analyzed: de yang gsum ste /
translated: Moreover, it is threefold,

original: snying stobs la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi dbye bas so //
analyzed: snying stobs la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi dbye bas so //
translated: by the division of the qualities of goodness, etc.

original: de la rags pa dang phra ba dang gzhan dang bzhi pa ste /
analyzed: de la rags pa dang phra ba dang gzhan dang bzhi pa ste /
translated: Therein, the gross, the subtle, the other, and the fourth.

original: de la rags pa ni bems po'i bag chags can rags par zhen pa rnams la sad pa'i dngos pos gzung ba'i phyir gnas skabs so //
analyzed: de la rags pa ni bems po'i bag chags can rags par zhen pa rnams la sad pa'i dngos pos gzung ba'i phyir gnas skabs so //
translated: Therein, the gross is the state of those who are attached to the gross, who have the instinct for the gross, because it is apprehended by the gross thing.

original: phra ba ni rmi lam gyi gnas skabs te yid kyi dbang pos sgyu ma'i dngos po bzung ba'o //
analyzed: phra ba ni rmi lam gyi gnas skabs te yid kyi dbang pos sgyu ma'i dngos po bzung ba'o //
translated: The subtle is the state of dreaming, in which the mental faculty apprehends illusory things.

original: gzhan ni shin tu gnyid log pa'i gnas skabs te dbang po thams cad 'gags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan ni shin tu gnyid log pa'i gnas skabs te dbang po thams cad 'gags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The other is the state of deep sleep, in which all the faculties cease.

original: bzhi pa ni ye shes kyi sku ste skye ba 'gog pa'i rgyu chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni ye shes kyi sku ste skye ba 'gog pa'i rgyu chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: The fourth is the body of intuition, which is the cause of the cessation of birth, and is the nature of the reality realm.

original: 'dir lta ba log pa ni 'khor ba dang / rgyu bdag yin pa dang / rgyu mi mthun pa dbang phyug gis 'khor ba byas zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir lta ba log pa ni 'khor ba dang / rgyu bdag yin pa dang / rgyu mi mthun pa dbang phyug gis 'khor ba byas zhes pa'o //
translated: Here, the false views are that cyclic existence is a circle, that the self is the cause, and that the cause is an inharmonious creator God who makes cyclic existence.

original: sa bon las myu gu ltar rgyu tshogs pa las 'bras bu 'byung ba dang / pha ma la sogs pa phan 'dogs pa'i zhing dang / rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas @260a * //
analyzed: sa bon las myu gu ltar rgyu tshogs pa las 'bras bu 'byung ba dang / pha ma la sogs pa phan 'dogs pa'i zhing dang / rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas @260a * //
translated: The result arises from the collection of causes, like a sprout from a seed; the field of benefit is the parents, etc.; the field of purification is the Buddhas, etc.;

original: la sogs pa yon tan gyi zhing dang / rgyu 'bras mi slu ba la yid ches pa ni 'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / gang thag chos kyi bdag med byang chub kyi rgyud yid ches pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lta ba bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: la sogs pa yon tan gyi zhing dang / rgyu 'bras mi slu ba la yid ches pa ni 'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / gang thag chos kyi bdag med byang chub kyi rgyud yid ches pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lta ba bskyed par bya'o //
translated: The conviction that the selflessness of phenomena is the cause of enlightenment is the correct view that transcends the mundane.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa las /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa las /
translated: The Foundations of Mindfulness Sūtra says:

original: rang gi dge dang mi dge'i las //
analyzed: rang gi dge dang mi dge'i las //
translated: Whatever virtuous and nonvirtuous actions

original: lus ngag yid kyi byed pa gang //
analyzed: lus ngag yid kyi byed pa gang //
translated: are done by body, speech, and mind

original: 'jig rten pa de 'bras la longs spyod //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa de 'bras la longs spyod //
translated: are enjoyed by the mundane person as their effects.

original: byed ba po gzhan gang yang med //
analyzed: byed ba po gzhan gang yang med //
translated: There is no other agent.

original: ces gsungs pa'i phyir grol ba dang 'ching ba yang rtog pa tsam ste /
analyzed: ces gsungs pa'i phyir grol ba dang 'ching ba yang rtog pa tsam ste /
translated: Therefore, liberation and bondage are mere conceptualization.

original: de yang rtog med kyi mnyam gzhag la mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de yang rtog med kyi mnyam gzhag la mi 'byung ngo //
translated: Moreover, they do not occur in nonconceptual meditative equipoise.

original: ji ltar chu len pa'i phyir bum pa khyer ba na nang du yod pa'i nam mkhar mi 'gro ste /
analyzed: ji ltar chu len pa'i phyir bum pa khyer ba na nang du yod pa'i nam mkhar mi 'gro ste /
translated: When a pot is carried for the purpose of fetching water, the space inside it is not carried,

original: de ci yang min pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ci yang min pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is nothing at all.

original: de ltar sems kyi chos mi skye mi 'gag mi 'byung mi rgas so //
analyzed: de ltar sems kyi chos mi skye mi 'gag mi 'byung mi rgas so //
translated: In the same way, the phenomena of the mind are not born, do not cease, do not arise, and do not age.

original: 'chi ba'i dus su snying stobs zhing ba'i sems kyis 'chi ba na lhar skye'o //
analyzed: 'chi ba'i dus su snying stobs zhing ba'i sems kyis 'chi ba na lhar skye'o //
translated: At the time of death, if the mind is courageous, one is reborn in the heavens.

original: mun pa'am / drag po'i sems kyis dmyal bar skye'o //
analyzed: mun pa'am / drag po'i sems kyis dmyal bar skye'o //
translated: If the mind is dark or violent, one is reborn in hell.

original: mi dge ba 'bring po rdul gyi sems kyis dud 'gror skye'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba 'bring po rdul gyi sems kyis dud 'gror skye'o //
translated: If the mind is of middling nonvirtue, like dust, one is reborn as an animal.

original: dge mi dge 'dres mas mir skye'o //
analyzed: dge mi dge 'dres mas mir skye'o //
translated: If there is a mixture of virtue and nonvirtue, one is reborn as a human.

original: yon tan gsum 'dres pa las snying stobs lhag na yi dags bzang por skye'o //
analyzed: yon tan gsum 'dres pa las snying stobs lhag na yi dags bzang por skye'o //
translated: If the three qualities are mixed, if courage predominates, one is reborn as a good ghost.

original: rdul lhag na bar mar ro //
analyzed: rdul lhag na bar mar ro //
translated: If dust predominates, one is reborn as a middling ghost.

original: mun pa lhag na dman par ro //
analyzed: mun pa lhag na dman par ro //
translated: If darkness predominates, one is reborn as an inferior ghost.

original: lha ma yin ni lhar 'dus so //🔽mi ni snying stobs lhag na bde ba dang ldan no //
analyzed: lha ma yin ni lhar 'dus so // mi ni snying stobs lhag na bde ba dang ldan no //
translated: The demigods are included in the gods.🔽If courage predominates among humans, they are happy.

original: rdul lhag na bde sdug can no //
analyzed: rdul lhag na bde sdug can no //
translated: If dust predominates, they are happy and suffer.

original: mun pa lhag na rtag tu sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: mun pa lhag na rtag tu sdug bsngal lo //
translated: If darkness predominates, they always suffer.

original: de ltar mtho ris su skye ba ni rnam pa brgyad de /
analyzed: de ltar mtho ris su skye ba ni rnam pa brgyad de /
translated: Thus, there are eight types of rebirth in the higher realms.

original: sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang nam mkha' dang nyi zla dang sgra gcan gyis zad par bsgom pa dang / sbyin pa dang tshul khrims la sogs pa'i stobs kyis so //
analyzed: sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang nam mkha' dang nyi zla dang sgra gcan gyis zad par bsgom pa dang / sbyin pa dang tshul khrims la sogs pa'i stobs kyis so //
translated: One meditates on the exhaustion of earth, water, fire, wind, space, sun, moon, and Rāhu, and by the power of generosity, morality, and so forth.

original: phung po bdag tu bzung ba dang longs spyod bdag tu bzung pas rigs drug tu 'khor ro //
analyzed: phung po bdag tu bzung ba dang longs spyod bdag tu bzung pas rigs drug tu 'khor ro //
translated: One cycles in the six realms by apprehending the aggregates as the self and apprehending enjoyments as the self.

original: bslab pa'i mdo sde dang / rtogs pa'i shes bya dang / sgra by'a ka ra na dang / tstshan dang / nges tshig dang / rtsis te yan lag drug dang ldan pa'i rig byed ni ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: bslab pa'i mdo sde dang / rtogs pa'i shes bya dang / sgra by'a ka ra na dang / tstshan dang / nges tshig dang / rtsis te yan lag drug dang ldan pa'i rig byed ni ma rig pa'o //
translated: The Vedas, which have six branches—the collection of aphorisms, the objects of knowledge of logic, the grammar of verbal roots, the etymologies, and calculation—are ignorance.

original: dran pa rnams ni shed bu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dran pa rnams ni shed bu la sogs pa'o //
translated: The Smṛtis are Śeṣa and so forth.

original: rtog pa ni 'jig rten gyi rtog pa'o //
analyzed: rtog pa ni 'jig rten gyi rtog pa'o //
translated: Conceptualization is worldly conceptualization.

original: dkyil 'khor 'khor lo la sogs pa bsgom pa ni rtog bcas so //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor 'khor lo la sogs pa bsgom pa ni rtog bcas so //
translated: Meditation on the maṇḍala wheel and so forth is conceptual.

original: rgyas pa'i snyan dang gas ni bha ra th'a'o //
analyzed: rgyas pa'i snyan dang gas ni bha ra th'a'o //
translated: The Bharata is the Smṛti of prosperity.

original: sna tshogs zos pa'i snyan dang gas ni bsgom pa'i chos so //
analyzed: sna tshogs zos pa'i snyan dang gas ni bsgom pa'i chos so //
translated: The Dharma of meditation is the Smṛti of the various foods.

original: grogs mo'i snyan dang gas ni r'a ma na'o //
analyzed: grogs mo'i snyan dang gas ni r'a ma na'o //
translated: The Rāmāyaṇa is the Smṛti of the female friend.

original: bdud @260b mda'i snyan dang gas ni lo rgyus kyi chos te 'di dag rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bdud @260b mda'i snyan dang gas ni lo rgyus kyi chos te 'di dag rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: The story of the arrow and the demon is a matter of history, and it is not a logical argument.

original: nang gi rig pa ni rnam pa thams cad dang ldan pa ni stong pa nyid zag pa med pa'i bdag nyid dmigs pa med pa'i snying rje rgyu dang 'bras bu gcig tu gyur pa gang las khams gsum skye ba ngang thim pa'o //
analyzed: nang gi rig pa ni rnam pa thams cad dang ldan pa ni stong pa nyid zag pa med pa'i bdag nyid dmigs pa med pa'i snying rje rgyu dang 'bras bu gcig tu gyur pa gang las khams gsum skye ba ngang thim pa'o //
translated: The inner knowledge is the one which is endowed with all the aspects, the emptiness which is the nature of the uncontaminated, the compassion which is without reference, the cause and effect which have become one, from which the three realms are dissolved into the womb.

original: de la goms pa'i rnal 'byor pa 'bras bu ma thob par 'chi na byang chub sems dpa'i rigs su skye zhing dang por goms pas dka' ba med par de'i ye shes thob bo //
analyzed: de la goms pa'i rnal 'byor pa 'bras bu ma thob par 'chi na byang chub sems dpa'i rigs su skye zhing dang por goms pas dka' ba med par de'i ye shes thob bo //
translated: If the yogi who is familiar with that dies without attaining the result, he is born in the lineage of the bodhisattvas and attains that knowledge without difficulty due to his previous familiarity.

original: de nas ma nyams pa'i go 'phang thob bo //
analyzed: de nas ma nyams pa'i go 'phang thob bo //
translated: Then he attains the stage of nonretrogression.

original: 'chi ba'i dus su yang sngar byas pa'i dge ba'i mthus zhen pa mtha' dag dang bral ba'i sems kyis 'chi na lhar skye'o //
analyzed: 'chi ba'i dus su yang sngar byas pa'i dge ba'i mthus zhen pa mtha' dag dang bral ba'i sems kyis 'chi na lhar skye'o //
translated: At the time of death, too, by the power of the virtue he has previously created, if he dies with a mind free from all attachment, he is born as a god.

original: gang gi phyir gang la zhen pa de nyid du skye'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gang la zhen pa de nyid du skye'o //
translated: Because he is born in whatever he is attached to.

original: ye shes skye ba dang longs spyad pa'i dus ni nyi ma phyed nas nam phyed kyi bar ro //
analyzed: ye shes skye ba dang longs spyad pa'i dus ni nyi ma phyed nas nam phyed kyi bar ro //
translated: The time for the arising of wisdom and enjoyment is from noon to midnight.

original: gang goms pas nyi ma ltar gyen du rgyu'o //
analyzed: gang goms pas nyi ma ltar gyen du rgyu'o //
translated: By being accustomed to that, one ascends like the sun.

original: mtho ris su 'gro ba'i lam ni snang ba dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: mtho ris su 'gro ba'i lam ni snang ba dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The path to the higher realms is with appearances.

original: gang zhig chos gang la 'jug pa'i brtul zhugs dang smyung gnas la dga' ba de'i chos la mngon par zhen pa de ni 'ching ba'o //
analyzed: gang zhig chos gang la 'jug pa'i brtul zhugs dang smyung gnas la dga' ba de'i chos la mngon par zhen pa de ni 'ching ba'o //
translated: For one who delights in the conduct and fasting that engages any phenomenon, the clinging to that phenomenon is bondage.

original: 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i bag chags dang bde ba la sogs pa'i tshor ba ji srid yod pa de srid du kun gzhi'i rnam shes ni srid par 'khor lo //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i bag chags dang bde ba la sogs pa'i tshor ba ji srid yod pa de srid du kun gzhi'i rnam shes ni srid par 'khor lo //
translated: As long as there are traces of desire, form, and formlessness and the feelings of pleasure and so on, the all-basis consciousness cycles in existence.

original: zla ba nyi ma'i 'chi ltas kyi rtsa chad pa ni sna bug g-yon dang g-yas su zhag sum cu so gnyis kyi bar ro //
analyzed: zla ba nyi ma'i 'chi ltas kyi rtsa chad pa ni sna bug g-yon dang g-yas su zhag sum cu so gnyis kyi bar ro //
translated: The life-threatening nāḍīs of the sun and moon are severed in the left and right nostrils for thirty-two days.

original: dus su 'chi ba la yang zhag so gsum gyis lus ngag yid gsum dang phung po khams dang dbang po la sogs pa stong par ro //
analyzed: dus su 'chi ba la yang zhag so gsum gyis lus ngag yid gsum dang phung po khams dang dbang po la sogs pa stong par ro //
translated: Even if one dies at the proper time, the body, voice, mind, skandhas, dhātus, and āyatanas, and so on, are empty in thirty-three days.

original: de nas rkyang ma dang ro ma spangs nas srog rlung zhag gcig dbu mar zhugs te dbu ma'i nang du dus kyi rlung gis mnan pas lte bar sgra la sogs pa'i yon tan lnga dang ldan pa stong ste sa 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas rkyang ma dang ro ma spangs nas srog rlung zhag gcig dbu mar zhugs te dbu ma'i nang du dus kyi rlung gis mnan pas lte bar sgra la sogs pa'i yon tan lnga dang ldan pa stong ste sa 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, having abandoned the lalanā and rasanā, the prāṇa wind enters the central nāḍī for one day. Since the wind of time presses down on the central nāḍī, the five qualities of sound, and so on, are empty at the navel, and the earth level is severed.

original: snying gar yon tan bzhi dang ldan pa'i chu yang ngo //
analyzed: snying gar yon tan bzhi dang ldan pa'i chu yang ngo //
translated: Having severed that, the water endowed with four qualities is severed at the heart.

original: de chad par byas nas mgrin par yon tan gsum dang ldan pa'i me bcad de /
analyzed: de chad par byas nas mgrin par yon tan gsum dang ldan pa'i me bcad de /
translated: Having severed that, the fire endowed with three qualities is severed at the throat.

original: dpral bar yon tan gnyis dang ldan pa'i rlung btang nas /
analyzed: dpral bar yon tan gnyis dang ldan pa'i rlung btang nas /
translated: Having severed that, the wind endowed with two qualities is released at the forehead.

original: spyi gtsug tu yon tan gcig dang ldan pa'i nam mkha' gtong ngo //
analyzed: spyi gtsug tu yon tan gcig dang ldan pa'i nam mkha' gtong ngo //
translated: Having severed that, the space endowed with one quality is released at the crown.

original: de ltar srog rlung gis gyen du khams gtong lugs so //
analyzed: de ltar srog rlung gis gyen du khams gtong lugs so //
translated: That is the way the prāṇa wind expels the elements upward.

original: lus kyi thig le'i chos can thur sel 'og tu gtong ste /
analyzed: lus kyi thig le'i chos can thur sel 'og tu gtong ste /
translated: The one endowed with the quality of the body’s bindu is expelled below by the evacuative [wind].

original: sad pa'i gnas skabs zad do //
analyzed: sad pa'i gnas skabs zad do //
translated: The state of waking is severed.

original: gsang gnas su ngag gi thig le'i chos can gtong ste rmi @261a * //
analyzed: gsang gnas su ngag gi thig le'i chos can gtong ste rmi @261a * //
translated: The one endowed with the quality of the voice’s bindu is expelled at the secret place.

original: lam gyi gnas skabs zad do //
analyzed: lam gyi gnas skabs zad do //
translated: The state of dreams is severed.

original: nor bus sems kyi thig le'i chos can gtong ste shin tu gnyid log pa'i gnas skabs zad do //
analyzed: nor bus sems kyi thig le'i chos can gtong ste shin tu gnyid log pa'i gnas skabs zad do //
translated: The gem emits the bindu of the mind, and the state of deep sleep ends.

original: de ltar gyen du yang snying mgul dpral bar rdul gyi thig le rnams srog gis gtong ste lus la sogs pa 'chad do //
analyzed: de ltar gyen du yang snying mgul dpral bar rdul gyi thig le rnams srog gis gtong ste lus la sogs pa 'chad do //
translated: In the same way, the bindu of the vital essence moves upward from the heart to the throat and forehead, and the body and so forth are severed.

original: tha mar drug pa'i ye shes kyi khams gtong ngo //
analyzed: tha mar drug pa'i ye shes kyi khams gtong ngo //
translated: In the end, the element of the gnosis of the sixth [stage] is emitted.

original: yan lag kun las sa bon 'og tu gtong ba dang / rdul gyen du 'gro ba ste bzhi pa'i gnas skabs zad do //
analyzed: yan lag kun las sa bon 'og tu gtong ba dang / rdul gyen du 'gro ba ste bzhi pa'i gnas skabs zad do //
translated: The seed syllable moves downward from all the limbs, and the bindu of the vital essence moves upward, and the state of the fourth [stage] ends.

original: de ltar mngal las skyes pa rnams 'chi'o //
analyzed: de ltar mngal las skyes pa rnams 'chi'o //
translated: In this way, those born from a womb die.

original: des na 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa bsgrub pa'i phyir lus kyi srung ba bshad de /
analyzed: des na 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa bsgrub pa'i phyir lus kyi srung ba bshad de /
translated: Therefore, the protection of the body is explained for the sake of accomplishing the mundane and supramundane.

original: lte ba snying gam gul pa dang // dpral ba spyi gtsug padma la //
analyzed: lte ba snying gam gul pa dang // dpral ba spyi gtsug padma la //
translated: In the navel, heart, throat, and forehead,

original: sa chu me rlung nam mkha' rnams //
analyzed: sa chu me rlung nam mkha' rnams //
translated: earth, water, fire, wind, and space

original: sdud par rab tu rgyu ba yin //
analyzed: sdud par rab tu rgyu ba yin //
translated: are the channels that move in the gathering.

original: phyi ru 'byung dang nang du bsdu //
analyzed: phyi ru 'byung dang nang du bsdu //
translated: Externally arising and internally gathering,

original: de ni skyed pas sa la 'jug / srog gi nus pa ni sdud pas phyir 'byung la skyed pas nang du 'jug go //
analyzed: de ni skyed pas sa la 'jug / srog gi nus pa ni sdud pas phyir 'byung la skyed pas nang du 'jug go //
translated: The power of life is exhaled by withdrawal and inhaled by generation.

original: thur sel gyi nus pa yang /
analyzed: thur sel gyi nus pa yang /
translated: The power of downward movement

original: lte ba gsang gnas nor bu'i nang //
analyzed: lte ba gsang gnas nor bu'i nang //
translated: is in the navel, secret place, and jewel.

original: lus ngag yid ni rim gyis rgyu //🔽phyi ru 'byung dang nang rgyu la //
analyzed: lus ngag yid ni rim gyis rgyu // phyi ru 'byung dang nang rgyu la //
translated: It moves through the body, speech, and mind in sequence.🔽It is the nature of withdrawal and generation

original: sdud dang skyed pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: sdud dang skyed pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: in external exhalation and internal inhalation.

original: zhes dbang mdor bsdus las so //
analyzed: zhes dbang mdor bsdus las so //
translated: This is from the Concise Tantra of Empowerment.

original: de bas sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin lus bsrung bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bas sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin lus bsrung bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the nature of buddhahood should be protected in the body.

original: lus med na sgrub pa yang med pas zag pa med pa'i bde ba yang med do //
analyzed: lus med na sgrub pa yang med pas zag pa med pa'i bde ba yang med do //
translated: If there is no body, there is no practice, and therefore there is no undefiled bliss.

original: byang sems bsrung ba'i phyir rtsa'i rnal 'byor ni rkyang ma dang ro ma nas dbu mar srog rlung bsgom pa dang / thur sel dung can ma bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: byang sems bsrung ba'i phyir rtsa'i rnal 'byor ni rkyang ma dang ro ma nas dbu mar srog rlung bsgom pa dang / thur sel dung can ma bsgom par bya'o //
translated: In order to protect bodhicitta, the yoga of the nāḍīs is the meditation on the prāṇa vāyu in the central nāḍī through the rasanā and lalanā and the meditation on the downward-clearing vāyu in the conch-shaped nāḍī.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa bsgrub pa'i phyir stong pa la du ba la sogs pa'i lam bla ma la bslabs te sna tshogs gzugs brnyan gyi bar du bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa bsgrub pa'i phyir stong pa la du ba la sogs pa'i lam bla ma la bslabs te sna tshogs gzugs brnyan gyi bar du bsgom par bya'o //
translated: In order to accomplish the supramundane, one should train in the higher path of smoke and so forth in emptiness and meditate up to the various reflected images.

original: de nas rtsa'i 'khor lo re rer srog dang thur sel la brten par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas rtsa'i 'khor lo re rer srog dang thur sel la brten par bya'o //
translated: Then, one should rely on the life and downward winds in each of the channel-wheels.

original: de nas sgra gcan ltar byang sems 'gog par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas sgra gcan ltar byang sems 'gog par bya'o //
translated: Then, one should block the bodhicitta like Rāhu.

original: srog dang thur sel sbyor nus pa'i rnal 'byor gyis lo gsum dang zla ba phyed pa gsum la phyag rgya chen po bsgrub bo //
analyzed: srog dang thur sel sbyor nus pa'i rnal 'byor gyis lo gsum dang zla ba phyed pa gsum la phyag rgya chen po bsgrub bo //
translated: The yogin who is able to unite the life and downward winds should accomplish the great seal in three years and three half months.

original: dus ma yin pa'i 'chi ba'i mtshan nyid ltar shes nas //
analyzed: dus ma yin pa'i 'chi ba'i mtshan nyid ltar shes nas //
translated: Having understood the characteristics of untimely death,

original: skyed dang sdud pa la gnas ba'i srog dang thur sel bkag la dbu mar sgra gcan dang dus kyi me'i nang du srog dang thur sel 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: skyed dang sdud pa la gnas ba'i srog dang thur sel bkag la dbu mar sgra gcan dang dus kyi me'i nang du srog dang thur sel 'jug par bya'o //
translated: one should block the life and downward winds abiding in the emanation and gathering and cause the life and downward winds to enter Rāhu and Kālamegha in the central channel.

original: nyin zhag gcig dbu ma'i nang du rgyu bar nus na dus ma yin par 'chi ba slu bar byed do //
analyzed: nyin zhag gcig dbu ma'i nang du rgyu bar nus na dus ma yin par 'chi ba slu bar byed do //
translated: If one is able to move them in the central channel for one day and night, one will deceive untimely death.

original: de ltar ma nus na btsan thabs kyis kyang bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar ma nus na btsan thabs kyis kyang bya'o //
translated: If one is unable to do that, one should do it by force.

original: @261b lte bar re bzhi dang gnas kyi phyi rol gyi bcu drug gis rlung skyed do //
analyzed: @261b lte bar re bzhi dang gnas kyi phyi rol gyi bcu drug gis rlung skyed do //
translated: In the navel, the four channels and the sixteen outside the locations generate wind.

original: 'di dag khams snyoms par bya ba'i phyir dang rlung dang gzer zhi bar bya ba'i phyir thur sel bsdam par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dag khams snyoms par bya ba'i phyir dang rlung dang gzer zhi bar bya ba'i phyir thur sel bsdam par bya'o //
translated: In order to balance the elements and to pacify wind and pain, one should block the downward-clearing wind.

original: dpral bar bcu drug dang spyi gtsug tu bzhi ste nyi shus ni bad kan skyed do //
analyzed: dpral bar bcu drug dang spyi gtsug tu bzhi ste nyi shus ni bad kan skyed do //
translated: In the forehead, the sixteen and in the crown, the four, the twenty generate phlegm.

original: de dag khams snyoms par bya ba'i phyir srog rlung gi rtsol bas bsdam par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag khams snyoms par bya ba'i phyir srog rlung gi rtsol bas bsdam par bya'o //
translated: In order to balance the elements, one should block the life-force wind with the āyāma.

original: thog mar srog rlung dang thur sel lan gsum bus la lce chung la bzhag ste /
analyzed: thog mar srog rlung dang thur sel lan gsum bus la lce chung la bzhag ste /
translated: First, one should blow the life-force wind and the downward-clearing wind three times and place it on the uvula.

original: phyi rol gyi rlung yid kyis drangs shing bdud rtsi 'thungs pas mkhris pa zhi bar byed do //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi rlung yid kyis drangs shing bdud rtsi 'thungs pas mkhris pa zhi bar byed do //
translated: By drawing in the external wind with the mind and drinking the elixir, bile is pacified.

original: snying gar brgyad dang mgul par so gnyis ni mkhris pa skyed do //
analyzed: snying gar brgyad dang mgul par so gnyis ni mkhris pa skyed do //
translated: In the heart, the eight and in the throat, the thirty-two generate bile.

original: gsang gnas kyi bcu ni 'dus pa skyed do //
analyzed: gsang gnas kyi bcu ni 'dus pa skyed do //
translated: In the secret place, the ten generate a combination.

original: de dag snyoms par bya ba'i phyir srog dang thur sel bsdam par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag snyoms par bya ba'i phyir srog dang thur sel bsdam par bya'o //
translated: In order to equalize them, one should block the life-force and the downward-clearing wind.

original: tshad pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: tshad pa la yang ngo //
translated: This is also for the treatment of fever.

original: gang gi phyir srog ni lte ba nas gyen du rgyu ba dang / thur sel 'og tu rgyu ba 'gog pa des rlung la sogs pa'i skyon thams cad sel lo //
analyzed: gang gi phyir srog ni lte ba nas gyen du rgyu ba dang / thur sel 'og tu rgyu ba 'gog pa des rlung la sogs pa'i skyon thams cad sel lo //
translated: Because the life-force moves upward from the navel and the downward-clearing wind moves downward, by blocking them all faults of wind and so on are removed.

original: bshad ba dang / gci ba sa bon gyi lam 'og tu thur sel bsdams nas zla ba dang / nyi ma dang me'i khams gyen du srog bsdams te de gnyis kha sbyar bas 'pho ba'i mes lus khyab cing dmu chu dang / mchin nad dang gzhang 'brum dang /
analyzed: bshad ba dang / gci ba sa bon gyi lam 'og tu thur sel bsdams nas zla ba dang / nyi ma dang me'i khams gyen du srog bsdams te de gnyis kha sbyar bas 'pho ba'i mes lus khyab cing dmu chu dang / mchin nad dang gzhang 'brum dang /
translated: By blocking the downward-clearing wind below the path of the seed of feces and urine, and by blocking the life-force above the fire, sun, and moon elements, by uniting those two, the fire of transference pervades the body, and it conquers ascites, liver disease, hemorrhoids,

original: dbugs mi bde ba dang glo nad dang brtan pa dang g-yo ba dang bcos ma'i dug dang mig nad dang klad gzer 'joms par byed do //
analyzed: dbugs mi bde ba dang glo nad dang brtan pa dang g-yo ba dang bcos ma'i dug dang mig nad dang klad gzer 'joms par byed do //
translated: respiratory ailments, and lung diseases, and it conquers the poisons of the stable and the moving, and it conquers eye diseases and headaches.

original: brla g-yas par rkang pa g-yon pa dang / brla g-yon par rkang ba g-yas pa ste /
analyzed: brla g-yas par rkang pa g-yon pa dang / brla g-yon par rkang ba g-yas pa ste /
translated: The left foot is in the right thigh, and the right foot is in the left thigh.

original: rdo rje'i skyil krung bcas pa la lag pa g-yon pa rgyab tu song bas rkang pa g-yon pa'i mthe bong dang g-yas pa'i mthe bong bzung bas dbugs bzung na rgyab kyi gzer 'joms par byed do //
analyzed: rdo rje'i skyil krung bcas pa la lag pa g-yon pa rgyab tu song bas rkang pa g-yon pa'i mthe bong dang g-yas pa'i mthe bong bzung bas dbugs bzung na rgyab kyi gzer 'joms par byed do //
translated: If one holds the breath while the left hand goes behind and holds the big toe of the left foot and the big toe of the right foot, this will destroy back pain.

original: rkang pa gnyis gyen du mgo 'og tu byas la srog 'gog pas bad kan 'joms so //
analyzed: rkang pa gnyis gyen du mgo 'og tu byas la srog 'gog pas bad kan 'joms so //
translated: If one turns the feet upward and puts the head below and stops the life-force wind, this will destroy phlegm.

original: gci ba dor ban srog rlung bsdams shing cung zad re stong pa goms pas chu 'gag zhi'o //
analyzed: gci ba dor ban srog rlung bsdams shing cung zad re stong pa goms pas chu 'gag zhi'o //
translated: If one stops the life-force wind and practices a little emptiness at the time of defecating, this will cure urinary retention.

original: snga dro gdong pa ma bkrus par ming med gnyis kyis so'i phreng mnyes pas mig gnyis la bskus pa dang chu lcag brgyab pas mig nad sel lo //
analyzed: snga dro gdong pa ma bkrus par ming med gnyis kyis so'i phreng mnyes pas mig gnyis la bskus pa dang chu lcag brgyab pas mig nad sel lo //
translated: If one massages the two rows of teeth with the two ring fingers without washing the face in the morning and smears the eyes with the resulting liquid, this will cure eye diseases.

original: gan rkyal du nyal te lag pa g-yon pas lte ba mnan nas srog rlung bzung bas ma zhu ba'i gzer ba 'joms so //
analyzed: gan rkyal du nyal te lag pa g-yon pas lte ba mnan nas srog rlung bzung bas ma zhu ba'i gzer ba 'joms so //
translated: If one lies on one’s back, presses the navel with the left hand, and holds the life-force wind, this will destroy stomach pain.

original: 'bras la sogs ba byung ba'i dus su mar dang tshvar ru gtums pas bdugs na 'phel ba 'joms so //
analyzed: 'bras la sogs ba byung ba'i dus su mar dang tshvar ru gtums pas bdugs na 'phel ba 'joms so //
translated: If one fumigates with a mixture of butter and salt at the time of the appearance of boils, etc., this will destroy their increase.

original: @262a * // aarga'i 'o ma byugs pas kyang bya'o //
analyzed: @262a * // aarga'i 'o ma byugs pas kyang bya'o //
translated: It is also done by anointing with the milk of the arka plant.

original: kanda ka ri'i me la bzhag pa'i dud pas gang ba'i sbubs so la yun ring por bdugs pas so'i srin bu dang bcas pa'i gzer 'joms so //
analyzed: kanda ka ri'i me la bzhag pa'i dud pas gang ba'i sbubs so la yun ring por bdugs pas so'i srin bu dang bcas pa'i gzer 'joms so //
translated: By fumigation for a long time with the smoke of the incense of the kanaka flower placed in a fire, it destroys the tooth worms and toothache.

original: du ba la sogs pa'i mtshan ma dang srog rtsol gyis ma nyams pa'i bsgrub pa la phyag rgya'i sbyor bas 'bab pa'i byang sems bde ba dam pa yang dang yang du bkag ste zla ba drug gis dkar mdze 'joms par byed do //
analyzed: du ba la sogs pa'i mtshan ma dang srog rtsol gyis ma nyams pa'i bsgrub pa la phyag rgya'i sbyor bas 'bab pa'i byang sems bde ba dam pa yang dang yang du bkag ste zla ba drug gis dkar mdze 'joms par byed do //
translated: By the practice of the signs of smoke and so forth, and by the practice of prāṇāyāma, the supreme bliss of the bodhicitta that falls through the union with a consort is repeatedly blocked. In six months, it destroys leprosy.

original: stobs med na sha dang chang longs spyod cing lo bcu drug ma bsten pas rlung bum pa can gyis nges par 'joms so //
analyzed: stobs med na sha dang chang longs spyod cing lo bcu drug ma bsten pas rlung bum pa can gyis nges par 'joms so //
translated: If one is weak, by enjoying meat and wine, and by relying on a sixteen-year-old girl, the vāyu of the vase will certainly destroy it.

original: lo bdun cu'i rgas pa gnyer ma dang skra dkar po dang bcas pa lo gnyis kyis so //
analyzed: lo bdun cu'i rgas pa gnyer ma dang skra dkar po dang bcas pa lo gnyis kyis so //
translated: The old age of seventy years with wrinkles and gray hair is destroyed in two years.

original: de rjes lo gsum dang zla ba phyed gsum gyis phyag rgya chen po 'grub bo //
analyzed: de rjes lo gsum dang zla ba phyed gsum gyis phyag rgya chen po 'grub bo //
translated: After that, in three years and three half months, mahāmudrā is accomplished.

original: bum pa can ni de srid du byed de ji srid snying tsha ba dang mgon ba mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bum pa can ni de srid du byed de ji srid snying tsha ba dang mgon ba mi 'byung ngo //
translated: One should practice vase-breathing for as long as one does not feel a burning sensation in the heart and a swelling in the head.

original: de'i phyis kyang byed na srog ni brgyal ba dang ma non pas spyi gtsug gas te 'gro'o //
analyzed: de'i phyis kyang byed na srog ni brgyal ba dang ma non pas spyi gtsug gas te 'gro'o //
translated: If one practices after that, the life-force will be lost, the head will split open, and one will die.

original: phyag rgya yang bde ba chen po bsgom pa'i don du yin gyi 'dod chags zad phyir ma yin no //
analyzed: phyag rgya yang bde ba chen po bsgom pa'i don du yin gyi 'dod chags zad phyir ma yin no //
translated: The seal is for the purpose of cultivating great bliss, not for the exhaustion of passion.

original: myos byed ni rgyal ba thams cad kyi bdag nyid phung po la sogs pa tshim par byed pa'i phyir te myos par byed pa'i phyir ma yin no //
analyzed: myos byed ni rgyal ba thams cad kyi bdag nyid phung po la sogs pa tshim par byed pa'i phyir te myos par byed pa'i phyir ma yin no //
translated: The intoxicant is for the purpose of satisfying the aggregates and so forth, which are the nature of all the conquerors, not for the purpose of intoxication.

original: sha la sogs pa'i bza' ba ni bde ba 'phel bar byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sha la sogs pa'i bza' ba ni bde ba 'phel bar byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: The food of meat and so forth is for the purpose of increasing bliss,

original: ma zhu ba'i phyir ma yin no //
analyzed: ma zhu ba'i phyir ma yin no //
translated: not for the purpose of indigestion.

original: mtshan mo dur khrod du 'gro ba ni spyod pa sgrub pa'i phyir te rtsed mo'i phyir ma yin no //
analyzed: mtshan mo dur khrod du 'gro ba ni spyod pa sgrub pa'i phyir te rtsed mo'i phyir ma yin no //
translated: The nocturnal cemetery wanderings are for the purpose of accomplishing conduct, not for the purpose of play.

original: mi bskyod pa cung zad dron po pi pi ling gi phye ma dang bsres te khar bcug ste bzung ba na kha'i nang dang so'i gzer dang srin bu sel lo //
analyzed: mi bskyod pa cung zad dron po pi pi ling gi phye ma dang bsres te khar bcug ste bzung ba na kha'i nang dang so'i gzer dang srin bu sel lo //
translated: If one holds a little warm cow's bezoar mixed with powdered long pepper in one's mouth, it will remove the pain in the mouth and the teeth and worms.

original: snga dro mi bskyod pa tsha ba gsum dang bsres pa sna bug tu blugs pas mgo na ba sel lo //
analyzed: snga dro mi bskyod pa tsha ba gsum dang bsres pa sna bug tu blugs pas mgo na ba sel lo //
translated: In the morning, one should put a little warm cow's bezoar mixed with the three hot medicines into one's nostrils. It will remove headaches.

original: lci ba dron mo rna bug tu blugs te bzhag na rna ba'i nad sel lo //
analyzed: lci ba dron mo rna bug tu blugs te bzhag na rna ba'i nad sel lo //
translated: If one puts warm cow dung into one's ear and leaves it there, it will remove ear diseases.

original: de grang mos mig nad sel lo //
analyzed: de grang mos mig nad sel lo //
translated: If one uses it cold, it will remove eye diseases.

original: mi bskyod pa tsha ba gsum dang bsres pa sna bug tu blugs pas 'byung po la sogs pa'i gnod pa sel lo //
analyzed: mi bskyod pa tsha ba gsum dang bsres pa sna bug tu blugs pas 'byung po la sogs pa'i gnod pa sel lo //
translated: If one puts a little warm cow's bezoar mixed with the three hot medicines into one's nostrils, it will remove harm from spirits and so forth.

original: dug sbrul gyis zin pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: dug sbrul gyis zin pa la yang ngo //
translated: It will also remove the effects of being bitten by a poisonous snake.

original: nang du bshad ba ni phyi rol du mu zi ste de gnyis mnyam mo //
analyzed: nang du bshad ba ni phyi rol du mu zi ste de gnyis mnyam mo //
translated: As for the internal ones, soot is external, and both are equal.

original: nang du dri chu ni phyi rol du bhrim ga r'a dza'i khu ba'o //
analyzed: nang du dri chu ni phyi rol du bhrim ga r'a dza'i khu ba'o //
translated: Internal urine is external Bhringa raja juice.

original: nang du bud med kyi zla mtshan ni phyir lhang tsher ro //
analyzed: nang du bud med kyi zla mtshan ni phyir lhang tsher ro //
translated: Internal menstrual blood is external lhang tsher.

original: khu ba ni phyir dngul chu'o //
analyzed: khu ba ni phyir dngul chu'o //
translated: Semen is external mercury.

original: nang du sha dang rkang mar ni phyi rol du 'bras bu gsum mo //
analyzed: nang du sha dang rkang mar ni phyi rol du 'bras bu gsum mo //
translated: Inside, one should use flesh and bone marrow; outside, the three fruits.

original: bshang ba cha gcig la ni bzhi cha gcig med pa'i @262b cha gcig / khrag ni cha phyed sa bon bzhi cha gcig ste thams cad phye mar btags te lci bas sbrus te lan bdun du nyi ma la bskam par bya'o //
analyzed: bshang ba cha gcig la ni bzhi cha gcig med pa'i @262b cha gcig / khrag ni cha phyed sa bon bzhi cha gcig ste thams cad phye mar btags te lci bas sbrus te lan bdun du nyi ma la bskam par bya'o //
translated: One part of feces is one part of the four parts of blood, and one part of the four parts of the seed. All of it is ground into powder and mixed with clay, and dried in the sun seven times.

original: de nas zhag re rer srang phyed phyed mar dang sbrang rtsi bsres te zla ba drug gi bar du zos na tshe ring bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas zhag re rer srang phyed phyed mar dang sbrang rtsi bsres te zla ba drug gi bar du zos na tshe ring bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, each day, one should eat half a pala of it mixed with clarified butter and honey for six months. One will have a long life.

original: lo ma dang sgyur ba dang tsha ba dang mar nag spang bar bya ste /
analyzed: lo ma dang sgyur ba dang tsha ba dang mar nag spang bar bya ste /
translated: One should avoid leaves, sour [foods], hot [foods], and oil.

original: bdud rtsi lnga bsten pa'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: bdud rtsi lnga bsten pa'i cho ga'o //
translated: This is the procedure for relying on the five nectars.

original: dbu mar srog rlung bkug la ke sa ra dza dang bhrim ga r'a dza'i khu ba dang mnyam po'i zla mtshan sna bug tu zla ba drug blugs pas skra dkar ba dang bcas pa'i rgas pa 'joms so //🔽ba lang / khyi /
analyzed: dbu mar srog rlung bkug la ke sa ra dza dang bhrim ga r'a dza'i khu ba dang mnyam po'i zla mtshan sna bug tu zla ba drug blugs pas skra dkar ba dang bcas pa'i rgas pa 'joms so // ba lang / khyi /
translated: One should inhale the life-force wind into the central channel and insert into the nostrils for six months the menstrual blood of a woman who is equal in age to oneself, mixed with the juice of kesara and bhringa raja. This conquers aging with its white hair.🔽cow,🔽dog,

original: glang po che /
analyzed: glang po che /
translated: elephant,

original: rta / mi'i sha rnams sbrang chang dang sbrang gis bsres te zla ba drug tu zos na nad thams cad sel lo //
analyzed: rta / mi'i sha rnams sbrang chang dang sbrang gis bsres te zla ba drug tu zos na nad thams cad sel lo //
translated: Mix horse and human meat with honey and beer, and eat it for six months. It will cure all diseases.

original: ke sar dza dang / bhrim ga r'a dza'i khu ba dngul chu dang / byang sems dkar dmar gnyis dang thams cad mnyam par srang phyed phyed lo gcig gi bar zos na rgas pa 'joms pa ste lo ma dang skyur po la sogs pa spangs nas so //
analyzed: ke sar dza dang / bhrim ga r'a dza'i khu ba dngul chu dang / byang sems dkar dmar gnyis dang thams cad mnyam par srang phyed phyed lo gcig gi bar zos na rgas pa 'joms pa ste lo ma dang skyur po la sogs pa spangs nas so //
translated: Take half a pala of the juice of kesaraja and bhringaraja, mercury, and the two types of bodhicitta, white and red, all equal, for one year. It will conquer aging, abandoning vegetables, sour substances, and so on.

original: tshva dang bcas pa'i skyur po 'thungs pas na rlung sel lo //
analyzed: tshva dang bcas pa'i skyur po 'thungs pas na rlung sel lo //
translated: Drinking sour substances with salt will remove wind.

original: ka ra la sogs pa mngar bas ni mkhris pa sel lo //
analyzed: ka ra la sogs pa mngar bas ni mkhris pa sel lo //
translated: Sweet substances such as sugar will remove bile.

original: bska bas ni bad kan sel lo //
analyzed: bska bas ni bad kan sel lo //
translated: Astringent substances will remove phlegm.

original: tsha ba gsum dang bcas pa'i khu ba yang ngo //
analyzed: tsha ba gsum dang bcas pa'i khu ba yang ngo //
translated: Also, drink the juice with the three hot substances.

original: tsha ba gsum dang bcas pa'i ra'i 'o ma 'thungs pa dang / sna bug tu blugs pas bad kan sel lo //
analyzed: tsha ba gsum dang bcas pa'i ra'i 'o ma 'thungs pa dang / sna bug tu blugs pas bad kan sel lo //
translated: Drinking the milk of a cow with the three hot substances and inserting it into the nostrils will remove phlegm.

original: ka ra dang bcas pa'i ma he'i 'o mas mkhris pa sel lo //
analyzed: ka ra dang bcas pa'i ma he'i 'o mas mkhris pa sel lo //
translated: The milk of a buffalo with sugar will remove bile.

original: rnga mo'i 'o ma rgyam tsha dang bcas na rlung sel lo //
analyzed: rnga mo'i 'o ma rgyam tsha dang bcas na rlung sel lo //
translated: If one drinks camel milk with rock salt, it removes wind disorders.

original: ba'i 'o ma tsha ba gsum dang bcas na bad kan sel lo //🔽ka ra dang bcas pas mkhris pa sel lo //
analyzed: ba'i 'o ma tsha ba gsum dang bcas na bad kan sel lo // ka ra dang bcas pas mkhris pa sel lo //
translated: If one drinks cow milk with the three hot medicines, it removes phlegm disorders.🔽If one drinks it with sugar, it removes bile disorders.

original: rgyam tsha dang bcas pas rlung sel lo //
analyzed: rgyam tsha dang bcas pas rlung sel lo //
translated: If one drinks it with rock salt, it removes wind disorders.

original: tshad pa med pa la mar yang ngo //
analyzed: tshad pa med pa la mar yang ngo //
translated: If one drinks it without any of those, it removes fevers.

original: dz'a ti'i lo ma de'i brgyad 'gyur chu la bskol te bzhi cha gcig cung zad dro ba khar bzhag na so'i nad dang kha nad sel lo //
analyzed: dz'a ti'i lo ma de'i brgyad 'gyur chu la bskol te bzhi cha gcig cung zad dro ba khar bzhag na so'i nad dang kha nad sel lo //
translated: If one boils eight parts of jasmine leaves in one part of water and leaves one-fourth of it remaining, slightly warm, and places it in the mouth, it removes tooth and mouth diseases.

original: til mar gyi khu ba dang ra'i chu mnyam por bskol te til mar tsam lhag mar bzhag ste tshva dang tsha ba gsum de'i bzhi cha gcig der bsres la grang mo rna ba'i nang du bzhag ban rna ba'i nad sel lo //

translated: If one boils sesame oil and goat's urine in equal parts until only the sesame oil remains, and adds one-fourth part of salt and the three hot medicines, and places it in the ear when cool, it removes ear diseases.

original: ba'i mar de brgyad 'gyur 'o ma dang bskol nas n'a ga ge sar gur gum gyi phye ma dang bsres la sna bug tu blugs pas sna'i nad sel lo //
analyzed: ba'i mar de brgyad 'gyur 'o ma dang bskol nas n'a ga ge sar gur gum gyi phye ma dang bsres la sna bug tu blugs pas sna'i nad sel lo //
translated: If one boils cow ghee with eight times its amount of milk, and mixes in the powder of nāga kesara and saffron, and inserts it into the nostrils, it removes nose diseases.

original: p'a nydza kam ko li dang / lam ka li dang / aindri dang / aindra ba ru ni dang / tig ta rnams bong bu'i chus btags te byugs pas @263a * //
analyzed: p'a nydza kam ko li dang / lam ka li dang / aindri dang / aindra ba ru ni dang / tig ta rnams bong bu'i chus btags te byugs pas @263a * //
translated: Pāṇḍaka, kaṃkoli, laṃkoli, indra, indravāruni, and tiktā are strained with the urine of a donkey and applied.

original: 'bras mang po 'joms so //
analyzed: 'bras mang po 'joms so //
translated: It destroys many kinds of leprosy.

original: 'brum bu'i nad la dang po tsha ba dang rkang lag gi tshigs dang mgo bo na ba'o //
analyzed: 'brum bu'i nad la dang po tsha ba dang rkang lag gi tshigs dang mgo bo na ba'o //
translated: In the case of smallpox, first there is fever, pain in the joints of the arms and legs, and headache.

original: de shes nas bu ga med pa'i khang par rkang pa gnyis mnyam par langs te lag pa gnyis brla la thug par thur du dbyangs te ma 'gyel gyi bar du bum pa can bsgoms te tshad pa las grol ba'i bar ro //

translated: Knowing that, in a room without openings, stand with the two feet together, lower the two arms to touch the thighs, and meditate on vase breathing until one does not fall over.

analyzed: snying ga'i zla ba las phrem yig dkar po las byung ba sna tshogs yum mam gzugs rdo rje ma zhal gcig phyag gnyis la rdo rje /
translated: From the moon at the heart, a white phrem arises, from which arises either Vajravārāhī or Rūpavajrā, with one face and two hands, holding a vajra and a lotus.

original: padma dang zla ba la rdo rje skyil krung du bzhugs pa /
analyzed: padma dang zla ba la rdo rje skyil krung du bzhugs pa /
translated: She sits in vajra posture on a lotus and moon.

original: g-yon gyi thugs kar padma dkar po'i yu ba bsnams pa /
analyzed: g-yon gyi thugs kar padma dkar po'i yu ba bsnams pa /
translated: At the heart on the left, she holds the stem of a white lotus.

original: g-yas pa mchog sbyin can srog rtsol gyis bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: g-yas pa mchog sbyin can srog rtsol gyis bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should meditate on the life-force with the right hand in the boon-granting gesture.

original: sran chung btags te chu grang mo dang bsres te btung ngo //
analyzed: sran chung btags te chu grang mo dang bsres te btung ngo //
translated: One should drink a paste of black gram mixed with cold water.

original: zhag gsum pa la 'brum pa skye ba na /
analyzed: zhag gsum pa la 'brum pa skye ba na /
translated: On the third day, when the boils appear,
