analyzed: 'brum pas shi ba'i thod pa'am gzhan bdar la mi bskyod pa bsres te btung ngo //
translated: one should drink a paste of the skull of one who died of boils, mixed with Akṣobhya.

original: aom phrem bi shva m'a tree badzra kanda ki n'a sha ya n'a sha ya che ge mo sh'antim ku ru sv'a h'a /🔽sngags 'dis yams drug dang gnod pa rnams la /
analyzed: aom phrem bi shva m'a tree badzra kanda ki n'a sha ya n'a sha ya che ge mo sh'antim ku ru sv'a h'a / sngags 'dis yams drug dang gnod pa rnams la /
translated: Oṃ phaṭ viśva-mātri vajra-kaṇḍa kīnaśaya nāśaya such-and-such śāntikaṃ kuru svāhā.

original: bdag dang gzhan bsrung ba'i phyir bzlas pa bya'o //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan bsrung ba'i phyir bzlas pa bya'o //
translated: With this mantra, one should recite for the protection of oneself and others against the six types of contagion and harm.

original: sman la yang lan bdun du bsngags par bya'o //
analyzed: sman la yang lan bdun du bsngags par bya'o //
translated: One should also enchant the medicine seven times.

original: 'dis dpral ba snying ga mgul pa lte ba gsang gnas spyi gtsug tu thun gsum bsrung bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dis dpral ba snying ga mgul pa lte ba gsang gnas spyi gtsug tu thun gsum bsrung bar bya'o //
translated: With this, one should protect the forehead, heart, throat, navel, secret place, and crown three times a day.

original: 'byung bos bzung ba la tsha ba gsum dang bsres la mi bskyod pa 'thungs na zhi ba'o //
analyzed: 'byung bos bzung ba la tsha ba gsum dang bsres la mi bskyod pa 'thungs na zhi ba'o //
translated: For possession by the elements, one should drink Akṣobhya mixed with the three hot herbs. This is the pacification.

original: da ni bcud len brjod de /
analyzed: da ni bcud len brjod de /
translated: Now, the alchemical elixir is described.

original: gser srang gnyis sbyangs pa dang / zangs ma lcags kanti dang / lhang tsher lcags kanti /
analyzed: gser srang gnyis sbyangs pa dang / zangs ma lcags kanti dang / lhang tsher lcags kanti /
translated: Two ounces of gold, copper, iron, and iron from a crematory,

original: ksha ti de dag cha mnyam par srang gnyis mu zi kha ma bkab pa la sman de dag gi bar kun du su barna ma kshi ka'i phye ma spang gnyis blugs te me drag po la bskol te gser gnas pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: ksha ti de dag cha mnyam par srang gnyis mu zi kha ma bkab pa la sman de dag gi bar kun du su barna ma kshi ka'i phye ma spang gnyis blugs te me drag po la bskol te gser gnas pa'i bar du'o //
translated: and kshanti, equal parts of two ounces, in an uncovered crucible, in between all of those medicines, two handfuls of the powder of swarnakshi, heated over a strong fire until the gold melts.

original: dngul chu srang bzhi la yung ba ma bcas pa dang so phag gi phye ma dang lhang tsher ras la lan bdun btsags la gser de dang bsres pa'i 'dag pa srang drug byas te ba'i dar ba mar med pa me drag po la bskol te ras la btsags
analyzed: dngul chu srang bzhi la yung ba ma bcas pa dang so phag gi phye ma dang lhang tsher ras la lan bdun btsags la gser de dang bsres pa'i 'dag pa srang drug byas te ba'i dar ba mar med pa me drag po la bskol te ras la btsags
translated: Four ounces of mercury, without the addition of turmeric, brick powder, and iron from a crematory, filtered seven times on cloth, mixed with that gold, six ounces of purified gold, boiled in a cow's hoof without butter over a strong fire, filtered on cloth,

original: nas tshigs ma dor te chur khu de khab len gyi snod la gser gyi 'dag pa dang bskol te srang gsum lus pa'i bar ro //
analyzed: nas tshigs ma dor te chur khu de khab len gyi snod la gser gyi 'dag pa dang bskol te srang gsum lus pa'i bar ro //
translated: the dregs discarded, that liquid boiled in an iron vessel with the purified gold until three ounces remain.

original: de ni zla ba drug gi zhag grangs dang mnyam par bskol te /
analyzed: de ni zla ba drug gi zhag grangs dang mnyam par bskol te /
translated: That is boiled for the number of days equal to six months.

original: ka ra phye ma 'dag pa srang brgyad dang / pho ba'i me drod dang cha @263b mthun par bdun nam dgu la sogs pa dang de'i drug cu cha gcig gis pho pa ris kyi phye ma dang bsres te bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: ka ra phye ma 'dag pa srang brgyad dang / pho ba'i me drod dang cha @263b mthun par bdun nam dgu la sogs pa dang de'i drug cu cha gcig gis pho pa ris kyi phye ma dang bsres te bza' bar bya'o //
translated: Eight tolas of pure sugar, seven or nine tolas of iron filings that are equal in quantity to the digestive heat of the stomach, and one sixty-fourth tola of iron filings are mixed together and eaten.

original: zas gzhan spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: zas gzhan spang bar bya'o //
translated: Other food should be avoided.

original: zla ba drug gis lha'i lus dang 'dra ba'i rgas pa dang gnyer ma dang 'chi med 'grub bo //
analyzed: zla ba drug gis lha'i lus dang 'dra ba'i rgas pa dang gnyer ma dang 'chi med 'grub bo //
translated: In six months, one will attain an ageless, wrinkle-free body like that of a god.

original: sman rdzogs pa dang ji srid 'tsho'i bar du ka ra phye ma cig bsres pa'i khur ni bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: sman rdzogs pa dang ji srid 'tsho'i bar du ka ra phye ma cig bsres pa'i khur ni bza' bar bya'o //
translated: When the medicine is finished, one should eat a load of sugar mixed with iron filings for as long as one lives.

original: da ni gser gyi phyed bsgyur brjod de /
analyzed: da ni gser gyi phyed bsgyur brjod de /
translated: Now, the transformation of gold is described.

original: bshad ma thag pa'i sa bon dngul chu de dang mnyam por bsres te tshva dang skyur po dang tshva'i rigs gzhan yang bsnur ji srid 'dres kyi bar ro //
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa'i sa bon dngul chu de dang mnyam por bsres te tshva dang skyur po dang tshva'i rigs gzhan yang bsnur ji srid 'dres kyi bar ro //
translated: The mercury just described is mixed with an equal quantity of gold filings, and churned with salt, sour substances, and other types of alkali until it is well combined.

original: de nas mu zi dang / lhang tsher dang / ldong ros dang / ba bla dang / zha nye dang / ka kshi dang / ka shi sha dang / dbyig dang / gser gyi btsag ste 'di dag cha mnyam par cha gnyis gong gi sman cha gcig dang gsum dngul chu dang cha mnyam pa'i nya'i mkhris pa pi dza p'u ra la sogs pa'i skyur por bsnur la de nas dngul gyi lab leb la bskus te zhag gsum gyi bar
analyzed: de nas mu zi dang / lhang tsher dang / ldong ros dang / ba bla dang / zha nye dang / ka kshi dang / ka shi sha dang / dbyig dang / gser gyi btsag ste 'di dag cha mnyam par cha gnyis gong gi sman cha gcig dang gsum dngul chu dang cha mnyam pa'i nya'i mkhris pa pi dza p'u ra la sogs pa'i skyur por bsnur la de nas dngul gyi lab leb la bskus te zhag gsum gyi bar
translated: Then, lampblack, lhang tsher, realgar, mica, lead, kashi, kashi sha, sulphur, and gold ochre—these in equal parts, two parts of each, one part of the above medicine, and equal parts of mercury and the bile of a lizard, etc., are boiled in an acid. Then, the silver foil is smeared with that and placed under a stove for three days.

original: du thab kyi 'og tu bzhag la thab kyi mes btsos bas gser du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: du thab kyi 'og tu bzhag la thab kyi mes btsos bas gser du 'gyur ro //
translated: By the fire of the stove, it is cooked and becomes gold.

original: de'i phyed gser dang 'dres pas gser gyi phyed bsgyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyed gser dang 'dres pas gser gyi phyed bsgyur ba yin no //
translated: Half of that mixed with gold is the transformation of half of the gold.

original: da ni 'dra min brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni 'dra min brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, the dissimilar will be described.

original: t'iksha na dang lhang tsher ni shing bha tri'i 'o mas spangs pas zhu ba dang ba bla dang rgya tsha dang ya baksha ra dang / spos dkar te /
analyzed: t'iksha na dang lhang tsher ni shing bha tri'i 'o mas spangs pas zhu ba dang ba bla dang rgya tsha dang ya baksha ra dang / spos dkar te /
translated: Tīkṣaṇa and lhang tsher are dissolved by the milk of the bhatri tree. Mica, soda, yavakṣāra, and white frankincense🔽are ground with the urine of a cow and the bile of a lizard.

original: t'i ksha na la sogs pa rim gyis gcig gnyis gsum bzhi lnga drug gi bar du cha je mang byas te thams cad bsres pa de zangs nyis 'gyur dang lugs kong gi nang du kha bkab la bskol nas /
analyzed: t'i ksha na la sogs pa rim gyis gcig gnyis gsum bzhi lnga drug gi bar du cha je mang byas te thams cad bsres pa de zangs nyis 'gyur dang lugs kong gi nang du kha bkab la bskol nas /
translated: Then, gradually, one part of taikshana and two, three, four, five, six parts of the others are mixed together. All of this is melted in a copper vessel with a double bottom and covered.

original: yang kha phye nas bskol te zangs lus pa'i bar ro //
analyzed: yang kha phye nas bskol te zangs lus pa'i bar ro //
translated: Then, after opening it, it is melted again until only the copper remains.

original: de cha las dag par byas te cung zad snyi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de cha las dag par byas te cung zad snyi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: This is made into a part and becomes slightly soft.

original: aarga'i rtsa ba dang / da dur ser po'i rtsa ba dang / ae randa'i rtsa ba dang / kshi ra kam tsug gi rtsa ba ste cha mnyam par btags pa'i dar ba la zhag bdun gyi bar du gzhag go //
analyzed: aarga'i rtsa ba dang / da dur ser po'i rtsa ba dang / ae randa'i rtsa ba dang / kshi ra kam tsug gi rtsa ba ste cha mnyam par btags pa'i dar ba la zhag bdun gyi bar du gzhag go //
translated: The root of arjuna, the root of yellow datura, the root of eranda, and the root of kshiraka are taken in equal parts and mixed with curd and left for seven days.

original: de nas bcu gnyis pa de gong ma'i nang du blugs te shin tu snyi bar gyur gyi bar du gzhag bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas bcu gnyis pa de gong ma'i nang du blugs te shin tu snyi bar gyur gyi bar du gzhag bar bya'o //
translated: Then, that twelfth part is poured into the above and left until it becomes very soft.

original: de cha gcig dngul cha gnyis dang bsres la 'dra min byas te dag par 'gyur ro zhes 'dra min gyi nges pa'o //
analyzed: de cha gcig dngul cha gnyis dang bsres la 'dra min byas te dag par 'gyur ro zhes 'dra min gyi nges pa'o //
translated: That is mixed with one part silver and two parts copper, and it becomes pure. This is the rule for making amla.

original: de ni chos pa rnams kyi 'tsho ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni chos pa rnams kyi 'tsho ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is for the sake of the livelihood of the practitioners.

original: chos pa'i kun rdzob ni sgyu ma lta bu'i dbu ma yin la /
analyzed: chos pa'i kun rdzob ni sgyu ma lta bu'i dbu ma yin la /
translated: The conventional of the practitioners is the middle that is like an illusion.

original: don dam pa ni rab tu mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: don dam pa ni rab tu mi gnas pa'o //
translated: The ultimate is the thoroughly nonabiding.

original: rdul phra rab ni rig pas ma @264a * //
analyzed: rdul phra rab ni rig pas ma @264a * //
translated: The subtle particle is not established by reasoning.

original: grab pas sems pa'i dngos po smra bar 'dod ba mi 'grub ste //🔽'di ltar bum pa la sogs pa'i dngos bo gcig tu ma grub ste /
analyzed: grab pas sems pa'i dngos po smra bar 'dod ba mi 'grub ste // 'di ltar bum pa la sogs pa'i dngos bo gcig tu ma grub ste /
translated: Therefore, the assertion of the entity of mind is not established.

original: steng 'og phyogs bcu'i dbye ba du mar gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: steng 'og phyogs bcu'i dbye ba du mar gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In this way, an entity such as a vase is not established as one because it becomes many, divided into above, below, and the ten directions.

original: cha shas yod par 'dod na /
analyzed: cha shas yod par 'dod na /
translated: If it is asserted that it has parts,

original: drug gis cig car sbyang ba na //
analyzed: drug gis cig car sbyang ba na //
translated: when it is simultaneously refined by the six,

original: phra rab rdul cha drug tu 'gyur //
analyzed: phra rab rdul cha drug tu 'gyur //
translated: the subtle particle becomes six parts.

original: cha shas med par 'dod na /
analyzed: cha shas med par 'dod na /
translated: If it is asserted that it is partless,

original: drug po dag ni go cig na /
analyzed: drug po dag ni go cig na /
translated: when the six are in one place,

original: gong bu'ang rdul phran tsam du 'gyur //
analyzed: gong bu'ang rdul phran tsam du 'gyur //
translated: the aggregate also becomes the size of a particle.

original: cha shas med na thogs pa med pa'i phyir phan tshun du thim mo /
analyzed: cha shas med na thogs pa med pa'i phyir phan tshun du thim mo /
translated: If it is partless, because it is unobstructed, it dissolves into the other.

original: khams gsum rnam shes tsam smra ba la brjod de rnam shes tsam yod de /
analyzed: khams gsum rnam shes tsam smra ba la brjod de rnam shes tsam yod de /
translated: This is said to be the assertion that the three realms are consciousness only.

original: don med na ci snang rnam shes tsam las phyi rol gyi don med na ci ste snang zhing 'dug / smras pa /
analyzed: don med na ci snang rnam shes tsam las phyi rol gyi don med na ci ste snang zhing 'dug / smras pa /
translated: [The opponent replies:]

original: bag chags kyi dbang gis so //
analyzed: bag chags kyi dbang gis so //
translated: They appear due to the power of latent propensities.

original: ji ltar rmi lam du med kyang snang ba bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar rmi lam du med kyang snang ba bzhin no //
translated: [We reply:] Just as in dreams, things appear even though they do not exist.

original: brjod pa / nyin mor mthong ba rmi lam snang //
analyzed: brjod pa / nyin mor mthong ba rmi lam snang //
translated: [The opponent replies:] What is seen in the daytime appears in dreams.

original: dngos po yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because things exist.

original: gang la don ni gtan nas med //
analyzed: gang la don ni gtan nas med //
translated: [We reply:] For whom does an object never exist?

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa la'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa la'o //
translated: [The opponent replies:] For the Yogācāra.

original: de la bag chags gang la 'byung //
analyzed: de la bag chags gang la 'byung //
translated: [We reply:] In that case, where do latent propensities arise?

original: dngos po gtan med pa yi phyir //
analyzed: dngos po gtan med pa yi phyir //
translated: Because things do not exist at all.

original: dngos po'i bag chags gang las 'byung //
analyzed: dngos po'i bag chags gang las 'byung //
translated: [The opponent replies:] From what do the latent propensities of things arise?

original: smras pa ma rig pa las so //
analyzed: smras pa ma rig pa las so //
translated: [We reply:] From ignorance.

original: brjod pa 'khor ba ma lus de yin no //
analyzed: brjod pa 'khor ba ma lus de yin no //
translated: [The opponent replies:] All of cyclic existence is that.

original: dngos po bag chags 'ba' zhig tu ma zad 'on kyang gnyis ka 'dod pa'i 'gro ba ma lus pa ma rig par grub ste /
analyzed: dngos po bag chags 'ba' zhig tu ma zad 'on kyang gnyis ka 'dod pa'i 'gro ba ma lus pa ma rig par grub ste /
translated: Not only are latent propensities of things asserted, but also all of cyclic existence is established as ignorance.

original: phyi rol nyid du snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi rol nyid du snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because things appear as external objects.

original: rnam shes de ni don dam 'dod //
analyzed: rnam shes de ni don dam 'dod //
translated: [The opponent replies:] Consciousness is asserted to be ultimate.

original: ma rig dang bral ga la srid //
analyzed: ma rig dang bral ga la srid //
translated: How could it be possible to be free from ignorance?

original: 'gro ba ma lus rnam shes tsam du khyod 'dod la /
analyzed: 'gro ba ma lus rnam shes tsam du khyod 'dod la /
translated: You maintain that all beings are consciousness only.

original: rnam shes te de yang don dam ma yin pas ma rig pa dang bral ba'i dus khyed la gtan nas mi srid do //
analyzed: rnam shes te de yang don dam ma yin pas ma rig pa dang bral ba'i dus khyed la gtan nas mi srid do //
translated: But that consciousness is not ultimate, so it is impossible for you to ever be free of ignorance.

original: da ni rnam shes tshe rabs tshe rabs su mi 'dod pa'i rgyang pan pa smra ste /
analyzed: da ni rnam shes tshe rabs tshe rabs su mi 'dod pa'i rgyang pan pa smra ste /
translated: Now you, the Charvakas, who do not accept consciousness in other lives, speak.

original: 'byung ba lnga ni yongs smin pas //
analyzed: 'byung ba lnga ni yongs smin pas //
translated: The five elements are fully matured

original: smyon pas nus bzhin sems byung ngo //
analyzed: smyon pas nus bzhin sems byung ngo //
translated: and the mind arises like the power of alcohol.

original: byung ba rnams kho na sems su 'gyur te /
analyzed: byung ba rnams kho na sems su 'gyur te /
translated: The elements alone become the mind.

original: chang las sngar med kyang yongs su smin pa'i tshe smyo bar byed pa'i nus pa skye ba bzhin no //
analyzed: chang las sngar med kyang yongs su smin pa'i tshe smyo bar byed pa'i nus pa skye ba bzhin no //
translated: Just as the power to intoxicate arises when alcohol is fully matured, even though it did not exist previously.

original: de ltar mngal dus la sogs pa yongs su smin pa las sems byung ste skye ba phyi ma dang thar pa med /
analyzed: de ltar mngal dus la sogs pa yongs su smin pa las sems byung ste skye ba phyi ma dang thar pa med /
translated: In the same way, the mind arises from the full maturation of the womb and so on. There is no next life and no liberation.

original: brjod pa / kye sdig can gal te 'byung ba rnams las sems sogs pa byung na de'i tshe ni shing dang lcags la sogs pa yang sa la sogs pa byung ba rnams yongs su smin pa yod pas /
analyzed: brjod pa / kye sdig can gal te 'byung ba rnams las sems sogs pa byung na de'i tshe ni shing dang lcags la sogs pa yang sa la sogs pa byung ba rnams yongs su smin pa yod pas /
translated: The reply is: O sinful one, if the mind and so forth arise from the elements, then since wood, iron and so forth are also the full ripening of the elements, earth and so forth,

original: de dang sbyor bas dam bcas yin //
analyzed: de dang sbyor bas dam bcas yin //
translated: they would be endowed with mind.

original: shing la sogs par cis mi 'byung //
analyzed: shing la sogs par cis mi 'byung //
translated: Why would mind not arise in wood and so forth?

original: @264b sems can la dbang bo dang bcas pa'i sems yod pa de bzhin du shing la sogs pa la yang 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: @264b sems can la dbang bo dang bcas pa'i sems yod pa de bzhin du shing la sogs pa la yang 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Just as sentient beings have a mind endowed with faculties, so too mind would arise in wood and so forth.

original: long bas nyi zla la sogs kyi gzi brjid de phung po ma mthong bas /
analyzed: long bas nyi zla la sogs kyi gzi brjid de phung po ma mthong bas /
translated: Since the blind do not see the brilliance of the sun and moon and so forth,

original: de med ces ni smras na yang //
analyzed: de med ces ni smras na yang //
translated: they say, “They do not exist.”

original: de la su zhig yid ches 'gyur //🔽stong pa nyid ltar thams cad las //
analyzed: de la su zhig yid ches 'gyur // stong pa nyid ltar thams cad las //
translated: But who would believe that?🔽It is extensively taught that all things

original: phyir 'byung las ni rgyas par gsungs //
analyzed: phyir 'byung las ni rgyas par gsungs //
translated: arise from emptiness.

original: gang gi lta ba stong nyid de //
analyzed: gang gi lta ba stong nyid de //
translated: One whose view is emptiness

original: de ni grol bya min par bshad //
analyzed: de ni grol bya min par bshad //
translated: is said to be liberated.

original: nang gi rgyud don zab mo las //
analyzed: nang gi rgyud don zab mo las //
translated: From the profound meaning of the inner tantras,

original: nang gi snye ma phyung bris las //
analyzed: nang gi snye ma phyung bris las //
translated: I have extracted the inner flower and written it.

original: byung ba'i dge bas 'gro ba kun //
analyzed: byung ba'i dge bas 'gro ba kun //
translated: By the virtue that arises from that, may all beings

original: nang la mkhas shing rgyal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: nang la mkhas shing rgyal bar 'gyur //
translated: Become skilled in the inner [sciences] and victorious.

original: nang gi snye ma zhes bya ba //
analyzed: nang gi snye ma zhes bya ba //
translated: The Inner Grain, called

original: rgya gar shar phyogs kyi dza gatta la'i pandi chen po bi bh'u ti tsandras phyogs gcig tu mdzad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: rgya gar shar phyogs kyi dza gatta la'i pandi chen po bi bh'u ti tsandras phyogs gcig tu mdzad pa rdzogs so /
translated: Compiled in one place by the great eastern Indian Jāḍala paṇḍita Vibhūticandra.

analyzed: // / pandi ta de nyid kyis rang 'gyur du mdzad pa'o//
